loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 31 years old and has been running a business of selling clothes. He is married to Margaret, and together they have been blessed with one child. Stephen has been selling clothes for the past ten years, with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to meet the needs of his family. 

Stephen is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET. He will use the loan to buy more clothes, for resale at a profit. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will pay school fees for his child and repay the loan. His hope and dream is to improve on the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Njuguna

texts.en:
Njuguna is 43 years old. A shopkeeper and part-time farmer, he is married to Phyllis. They are blessed with one child. Njuguna has been running his shop for the past three years, with a monthly income of ksh 9,000 which he uses to provide for the needs of his family.  

Njuguna is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Njuguna will use the loan to buy dairy cows. With the expected profit from his farm he will expand his shop. 

His hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a 34-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Priscilla, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child. 

Duncan has been farming for the past ten years. His monthly income is approximately 12,000 KES, which he uses to pay for his family's living expenses.  

Duncan is applying for his first loan from KADET. He would like to use the loan proceeds to buy livestock for his farm. With the profits he expects to generate as a result of the loan, he plans to engage in large-scale farming operations. 

In the future, Duncan hopes to be able to educate his child and to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her hamburger stand.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es: Segundo, de 43 años de edad, es padre soltero de 4 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Segundo se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un mototaxi que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros, lleva en está actividad un promedio de 5 años. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Se inició por la necesidad de contar con un trabajo, ya que no podía conseguir un empleo, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad pues puede manejar su horario laboral libremente, además de ser su propio jefe. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra o sufre algunos daños de manera continúa pues le ocasiona muchos gastos, pero aun así logra ver resultados positivos aunque desea mayor seguridad, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su actividad de transporte comprándose un vehículo de carga pesada ya que el pago en este tipo de transporte es mucho mayor. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para poder alcanzar sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado refaccionará su mototaxi comprando espejos, llantas y aro que necesita para que pueda seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Segundo, 43 years old, is a single father of four children with whom he lives in in his own home. Segundo makes a living providing passenger transportation services in a motorcycle taxi which he bought with his savings. He has worked in this job for about five years. He likes his business because it allows him to have an economic income with which he can settle his family expenses.

 He began because of the necessity of counting on a job, since he could not find employment. Now he feels that he has greater security since he can manage his work schedule freely, as well as being his own boss. On the contrary, he comments that he does not like when his motorcycle taxi fails or needs ongoing repairs since it causes him many expenses. He still is able to see positive results although he wishes for more security. Because of that he has plans to make his transportation job grow by buying a heavy-load vehicle since the pay for this type of transport is much higher.

In this opportunity he will request 1500 Nuevo Soles. He is thankful for the financial support that he will receive to be able to reach his objectives. With the amount requested he will repair his motorcycle taxi by buying mirrors, tires, and rims that he needs to be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy replacements like mirrors, tires, and rims for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en: As a married mother of six children, Merilyn works hard to support her family.  She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Merilyn is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.  Merilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Marcelo

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz y frijol; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los materiales agrícolas, como lo son; abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
Comenta don José que el crédito anterior le permitió fortalecer su negocio, ya que logro adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios para el cultivo.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting a new loan to continue investing in basic grain cultivation, including corn and beans. This investment will help him buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, pest control, insecticides, and other products.

Jose mentions that his previous loan strengthened his business because he was able to get the agricultural supplies necessary for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, pest control, insecticides, and other products.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Originally from Sa Ang district of Kandal provice, Sem is 54 years old and a father of four children; some of them are now still in school.  His main source of income for his family is from his bean planting business.  The main challenge for his business is the low yield due to pests.  To overcome this challenge, he is applying for a new loan.  His prior loan from Vision Fund (Kiva's partner) has enabled him to improve his lifestyle and make it better than before.  Now he is seeking a loan of 2,800,000 KHR in order to fix his water pump and buy bean seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for his farmland.  He hopes that he can gain a good yield from his crop so he can make more income to keep his children in school until college.

loans.use: to fix his water pump and buy bean seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en: Jean Baptiste is a 49-year-old man from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda.  He is seeking a loan of  RWF 60,000 to purchase rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village.  Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  He is also a mason and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: to pay for low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 35-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 7 to 12 years old. Pauline describes herself as patient. She operates a food stall where she sells potato chips, fruits, and other foods. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area that is good for business and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather which affect her business. 

Pauline will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy potatoes, cooking oil, and other ingredients to prepare food. Her business goal is to have a restaurant within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy potato chips, cooking oil, and other ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is a 36-year-old, married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be highly self-motivated. 

Teresiah operates a grocery store where she sells mangoes, bananas, cabbages, and onions. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more mangoes, bananas, cabbages, and other items for resale. 

Her business goal is to own a big shop within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will live a happy and healthy life. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes, bananas, cabbages, and other items for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 28-year-old, married man. He has two children with ages one year and three years. He describes himself to be self-motivated. 

David operates a transport business where he transports customers, using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

David will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy bicycles for hire services.This will enable him earn extra income. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will be prosperous.

loans.use: to buy bicycles for hire services

loans.name: Shirlys

texts.es: Desde hace 2 años, una amiga de Shirlys la motivó para que iniciara su propio negocio, vendiendo mercancías, pues ella, su amiga,  también comercializaba productos mediante guías especializadas. Así fue que inició Shirlys su pequeño emprendimiento, vendiendo perfumería, accesorios femeninos, blusas y ropa casual en general. Sus ventas las hace hoy en día, a crédito y de contado a un a clientela fija, que poco a poco ha ido construyendo, a lo largo de su tarea comercial. Shirlys realiza su trabajo de ventas, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, y sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y referidos de estos. Su meta familiar al lado de su cónyuge, es tener su propia casa y su mayor desafío, es lograr reunir los recursos suficientes para obtenerla. En la actualidad Shirleys solicita un credikiva,primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará bolsos, perfumería y accesorios femeninos y para el hogar, con ello planea aumentar sus inventarios , para ganr un poco mas, pues Shirlys a sus 23 años tiene muchos sueños de prosperidad que muy seguro alcanzará, con la dedicación que la caracteriza y con mucho trabajo en su negocio
texts.en:
Two years ago, Shirlys's friend convinced her to start her own business selling merchandise. Her friend also sold products through specialized booklets. This is how Shirlys started her small business by selling perfume, women's accessories, blouses, and other casual clothing. She currently makes sales on credit and in cash to regular customers she gained little by little through her commercial activity. Shirlys works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and her primary customers are her neighbors, friends, and their referrals. Her and her spouse's family goal is to have their own house. Their primary challenge is to come up with sufficient resources to do so.

Shirlys is now requesting a Kiva loan, which is her first financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the loan, she will buy bags, perfume, women's accessories, and home goods to increase her inventory and earn a bit more. At 23 years old, Shirlys has many dreams of prosperity that she will surely achieve with her dedication and hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy bags, perfume, women's accessories, and home goods.

loans.name: Pleanh's Group

texts.en: Pleanh, a citizen from Kandal province’s Sa Ang district, is 61 years old and blessed with six children.  To sustain her living, she grows rice on one hectare of land and plants mango on half a hectare of land.  This business gives her about 9,300 KHR per day.  Pleanh is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) who has completely repaid her past loans, which have improved her living condition.  Moreover, she could afford to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand her rice growing business.  For this new loan she is teaming up with a group of four to get a new loan from VisionFund.  As the leader of the group, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and insecticide for her farmland.   She hopes that this purchase will support her crop on time and gain high yields.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 25 years old and is married to Concolata.  They currently have no children.  He is in the business of selling clothes in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has been doing for one year.  He has applied for his third loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him to buy more stock of clothes and shoes to sell.  He plans to buy a cow with the anticipated profit.  He hopes to expand his clothes business and be economically stable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joycee

texts.en: Joycee is 30 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her husband and three children; only two of her children are in school.  Her children are between the ages of 2 and 11.  She says she stopped her education in the 12th grade.  For four years now she has been selling plantains, bananas, bitter-balls, peppers, and oil in the local market, and she doesn’t have enough income to buy more stock for her business. She spends ten hours a day, six days per week selling these goods.  Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more plantains, bananas, bitter-balls, peppers, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Maurecia

texts.en: Maurecia works hard to support her family.  She has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Maurecia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She has been in this business for 8 years now.  In the future, Maurecia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Irania

texts.es: Irania, de 32 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Irania consiste en hacer tortas para ponerlos a la venta. A diario ella prepara este delicioso postre para que pueda venderlos en su barrio y zonas cercanas a su casa o para cumplir con algunos pedidos que tiene, realiza esta actividad en su casa en donde tiene acondicionado un modesto taller de repostería conformado por un horno eléctrico y algunos moldes, a pesar de esto es muy responsable en su trabajo ya que siempre tiene clientes que le solicitan una determinada cantidad de kekes que posteriormente se encargan de vender en porciones personales. Realiza este trabajo hace 2 años y en este tiempo a obtenido la suficiente experiencia para conocer el gusto de sus clientes. Complementa su labor con la venta de perfumes, talcos y otros productos cosméticos. Tiene muchos planes a futuro pero lo que mas desea es tener un taller mas grande e implementado en donde pueda tener mayor producción. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 500, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía para continuar trabajando con mucha tranquilidad, ella por su parte se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes e insumos como harina, leche, huevos, mantequillas y otros productos que necesita para preparar sus postres.
texts.en:
Irania, 32, is married with two children living with her in her own house.  Irania’s work consists in making cakes and putting them up for sale.  She prepares this delicious dessert daily to sell in her neighborhood and in zones near her house or to fill orders she gets.  She does this activity at home where she’s set up a modest pastry workshop consisting of an electric oven and some cake molds.  Despite this, her she’s very responsible with her work because she always has customers ordering specific numbers of cakes who then resell them in individual portions.  She’s been doing this work for two years and has gained sufficient experience in this time to know her customers’ taste.  She complements this work with perfume, talc and cosmetics sales.  She has many future plans but what she most wants is to have a larger, well-equipped workshop so that she can increase production.

On this occasion she’s going to request 500 soles.  She’s very happy to know that she’s going to have financial support that will guarantee her being able to continue to work with peace of mind.  On her part, she commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the amount requested to buy supplies and ingredients like flour, milk, eggs, butter and other products needed to make her desserts.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, eggs, milk, butter, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Lostenia

texts.es:
Gloria, le surge la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar maíz y láminas para construir su espacio para mejorar el negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo mejorar sus ingresos y con ello ha logrado incrementar la clientela. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: Gloria needs to get another loan because she needs more working capital to continue in her business making and selling tortillas.  This investment will help her buy corn and metal sheeting to build space to improve the business.  Her previous loan helped her to improve her income and she’s increased her clientele too.  Her economic conditions and family circumstances have optimized.

loans.use: to buy corn and metal sheeting..

loans.name: Jose Reyneri

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en el cultivo de granos básicos, tales como: maíz y frijol; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los materiales agrícolas, abono, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas para el cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos; su sueño es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en: José needs to get a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue growing basic grains like corn and beans.  This investment will help him buy agricultural supplies like manure, pesticide, fungicide, insecticide and others.   His previous loan helped him acquire the agricultural supplies for his crops and to earn higher income.  His dream is to support his children’s schooling and to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Bihanga Bakyara Twimukye Group

texts.en:
BIHANGA BAKYARA TWIMUKYE GROUP is located in Kajara area, Ntungamo district. It comprises of women  and a few men whose major activity is farming. Many of the ladies are single mothers or widows; only a few are married. 

The group  applied for loan of ugx.3,500,000. They will divide this money amongst themselves; their prime target is to change the lives of their families and also to send their children to better schools. However  they are limited by lack of capital and funds to enable them to achieve their dreams. 

Enid, believes that with this loan she will improve production on her farm by buying organic fertilizers and pesticides. This will increase production on her farm. Her dream is to improve the lifestyle of her family members. She hopes that their lives of her family members and those of the group members will then have a positive impact on their society.In the photograph are some of the group members who got loans in this cycle, plus the loan officer who is at the forefront extreme left(a gentleman in a tie).

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of used skirts and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey and his family have been renting but recently bought a house, which he is using as security for the UGAFODE loan. Godfrey is a resident of Namuwongo zone a city surburb.
Godfrey is a married man. His wife is Edith, and they have two children. Godfrey is a client of UGAFODE who operates a shoe-selling business. He started the business in 2010, with initial working capital of ugx.250,000. It has grown gradually, and currently the business uses operating capital of approximately ugx.1,500,000. He has also opened up a small retail shop in Namuwongo, which is generating for him some daily income.

Godfrey applied for a loan of ugx.2,000,000, purposely to boost his business by increasing working capital. He will use the loan funds to buy used shoes, which he will sell to generate income. However, he faces challenges of high rent costs and competition.

loans.use: To buy used shoes to sell

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.en:
Benjamini, who is in his late 60s, is married with 11 grownup children. He has seven grandchildren. The grandchildren are staying with their parents. He has been running two businesses: growing rice out of Dar es Salaam and selling running water through taps. He has been in these businesses for one year now. He works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 
 
This will be Benjamini’s 18th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to add more water tanks and sold a lot of water. He bought a shamba where he is growing rice and is making good money. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to cater for his and his wife’s needs, such as hospital bills, food, dresses, etc. He will use this loan to start selling vegetables, to sell water, and to grow more.

Benjamini will share this loan with his loan group  “TWITANGE,”  which has six members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling vegetables, to sell water, and to grow more.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman, and she has four children, three of whom attend school. Mishi lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mishi operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruit and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more boxes of tomatoes, oranges, and onions

loans.name: Mumbua

texts.en:
Mumbua is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable vendors in her business. With the Kshs 10,000 Mumbua wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 30 years old. She is a potato grower and she has been running her farming for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use in potato production. The profits from the potatoes will be used for reinvesting in the potato farm.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and seeds for use in potato production.

loans.name: Chelangat

texts.en:
Chelangat is a young hardworking lady, 25 years old and married. She is the mother of 2 children, ages four and eight. She has been running a retail shop for the last 4 years getting a monthly income of about KES 5,000. Chelagat has applied for a second loan after successfully paying off the previous one. 

With a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET she plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable products. The anticipated profits will be plowed back into the business for expansion and to repay the loan. Chelangat's dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to restock her retail store.

loans.name: Maria Carmelina

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar  en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar dos cerdos para crianza y engordarlos para destazarlos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos; es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en: María needs to opt for a new loan because she needs more working capital to stay in business.  This investment will help her buy two pigs to raise, fatten up and then butcher.  Her previous loan helped her increase her sales and improve her income.  Because of this, economic conditions and family circumstances have optimized.

loans.use: to buy two pigs to raise, fatten up and then butcher.

loans.name: Soknin's Group

texts.en:
Soknin is 34 years old and a resident from Kandal province, where she runs her business in order to generate a decent income for her family. She has one child who is still in school. For the sake of her family, she strives for a living via selling cafe (high quality coffee) in the area while her husband drives a taxi to supplement her income. This business has returned her about 15,000 KHR per day. 

Soknin is a fourth time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has enabled her to set aside some money to buy a decent car for her husband to operate as a taxi and to start up a small cafe (coffee) shop. Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy ingredients for her cafe selling business including cafe and sugar. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her cafe selling business including Cafe and sugar

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is 47 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Melanie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of candies, chips, noodles, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of candies, chips, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Faruku

texts.en:
Faruku is a new client; he is married to Sulaina and has one child.  He resides in the Nyakanengo area in Ntungamo district. 

He has a poor banana plantation and a few coffee plantations; with the loan he will buy mulch to increase the productivity of his banana plantation. He is facing a challenge of low productivity.  He hopes that when the plantation improves, he will increase his earnings and improve on the livelihood of his family members.
 
His dream is to become a commercial farmer and buy his own transport van for taking his foodstuffs to the market; apparently he uses a motorcycle to transport his agricultural products but its ineffective. 

With this loan, he hopes to improve his banana plantation. In the photograph is the credit officer in a tie and Faruku with the motorcycle that he uses for transport.

loans.use: To buy mulch for his banana plantation

loans.name: Navoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Navoeurn is 58 years old and a villager from the Sa Ang district of Kandal Province. She is the mother of three children. To provide three decent meals for her family, she manages a half-hectare mango farm, while her husband helps her to supplement their income via teaching at a local school. The farm is the business that Navoeurn has had for 25 years, and it has returned her about 27,900 KHR per day. 

She is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is the fourth loan for Navoeurn’s group which consists of two borrowers. Navoeurn has fully paid back her previous loan wisely and it has upgraded her lifestyle to be better than before. 

For this cycle, she is seeking 500,000 KHR and her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, Navoeurn will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her mango trees to boost her yield. She hopes that she can make more income from her business to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her mango trees.

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita is 34 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 7. Many years ago she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Ramita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old, married to Mary, and they have two children, ages 16 and 10 years old. 

He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for six years and has applied for his seventh loan from Kadet ltd to enable him to buy fertilizer and spraying chemicals. He plans to boost his farming business with the anticipated profit.

Peter hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Kadet ltd to build a strong financial base in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 31 years old and married to Charles.   They have three children, who are in school.

She has a business selling fish in Naivasha, which she has operated for 13 years. She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to purchase more stocks of fish. 

Hellen plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit.  In the near future, she hopes to become a fish supplier in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of fish.

loans.name: Ma. Rolita

texts.en:
Rolita is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling native vinegar. Rolita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Vannary

texts.en:
Vannary is 38 years old and a mother of four schoolchildren residing in Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. She deals with her daily cost of living via rice farming as a main source of income. Nowadays, she can earn about 89,000 KHR per day from the current business that she has had for 20 years. 

Vannary is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now seeking for 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. Additionally, she will spend a portion of it to buy piglets for raising extra income. She hopes to support her needs, make a good profit for her family, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise for extra income.

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a 50-year-old man from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  

Bosco is also a farmer, and he plans to invest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel, está casado, tiene la edad de 46 años y vive con su esposa y 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su siembra de chile, el comprara los abonos, plaguicidas, y todo tipo de producto que sea necesario para mantenerlos en optimas condiciones. El está comenzando con este proyecto nuevo y espera le valla muy bien pues es muy buena alternativa de trabajo para muchas personas de su comunidad como mano de obra y a la vez espera obtener muy buenas ganancias del proyecto para mejorar su nivel económico e ir fortaleciendo su economía para el futuro. Espera poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y salir adelante con todo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Daniel is married, is 46 years old, and lives with his wife and three children, who are his greatest priority in life. With the loan that he is seeking he will buy inputs to help him in the cultivation of chili peppers. He will buy fertilizers, pesticides, and all kinds of products that are necessary to provide optimum conditions for his crop. 

He is starting this new project and hopes that it will go very well and that he will be able to provide a good employment option for many people in his community as labor. At the same time he hopes to make a good profit from the project, and so improve his financial position and continue to strengthen his finances into the future. He hopes to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and to help them do well in everything.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not previously received other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow chili peppers.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives on a farm outside of Kwale town, in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Monica is married, and has five children. Both her and her husband have been farming for seven years, and are currently growing mangoes on their land. Monica likes beekeeping because the bees help with pollination, increasing crop production. 

This is Monica's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated by her hives to save up enough money to build a chicken coop. When asked about her hopes and dreams for the future, Monica says that she wants to build a good home for her family.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
A local villager from Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Mak is the mother of two children.  

The entire household relies on a single business: vegetable farming, including corn, beans, and sesame.  She is able to generate about KHR 18,700 per day from this business, which has occupied her for 10 years. In this cycle, she is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans have enabled her to support her business on time. 

For this cycle, she is seeking a new loan to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her crop and to plow her farmland. She hopes that she can get a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 35 years old and married to Jane.  They have two children, aged 8 years and 8 months. 

Alex has a boutique in Ndunyu Njeru that he has operated for ten years and also a barber shop. 

He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy more stocks of clothes for sale.  He plans to buy a power saw with the anticipated profit.

He hopes to expand his businesses so as to improve the living standards of his family in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Saidbiby

texts.ru: Саидбиби целеустремленная женщина. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Она единственная кормилица в семье. Саидбиби начала свой бизнес купле продажей тканей несколько лет назад, так как после смерти мужа она пережила трудные времена. Она введет своё дело успешно. Саидбиби хочет, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование и стали высококвалифицированными специалистами. Ее сын в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Саидбиби должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Saidbiby is a purposeful woman with four children. She is a widow and the sole breadwinner in the family. Saidbiby started her business buying and selling fabric several years ago, after going through difficult times since the death of her husband. She has successfully kept it going and wants her children to receive a higher education and to become highly qualified specialists. Her son graduated from high school this year and got into university. Saidbiby needs to pay her son's tuition and is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD to do so. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes, who is married, works hard to support her family. 

Mercedes has a business buying and selling rice grain in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell.  Mercedes has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Mercedes would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Mauren

texts.es: Mauren, está soltera, tiene la edad de 22 años, vive con sus padres y 3 hermanos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito va comprar unas novillas. Su familia cuenta con grandes repastos de terreno que están vacios por los cual ellas opto en invertir en la comprar de estos animales para explotar al máximo el terreno obtenerle ganancias. Ella espera poder y tener los animales listos rápido para su venta y poder sacarle el máximo de ganancias a la hora de la venta para ayudarse con el estudio y con el bienestar de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mauren is single and is 22 years old.  She lives with her parents and 3 siblings, who are her main priority.  With this loan, she is going to buy some heifers.  Her family has extensive pasture lands that are empty, and so she has chosen to invest in the purchase of these animals so that she can take as much advantage as possible of this land in order to generate earnings.  She hopes to have the animals ready to sell quickly, so that she can get maximum earnings from her sales to help with her education and the well-being of her family.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She hadn't taken other loans before from the state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her with a loan with better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Ndack

texts.fr: Madame Ndack est une femme âgée de 54ans qui habite aux environs du Guichet et est à son 3ème prêt. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants, elle évolue dans le commerce de friperies et a une expérience de plus de 15ans dans cette activité. NDACK a besoin de ce prêt pour augmenter son stock et mieux satisfaire ses clients. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais d’scolarité de ses enfants. Ndack commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18H. A l’avenir elle souhaite développer son commerce avec l’aide de l’IMCEC pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa grande famille.
texts.en:
Ndack is a 54-year-old married mother of 10 children who lives near her UIMCEC local branch. She is on her third loan and has been in the business of second-hand clothes for over 15 years. Ndack starts her day at 9:00am and finishes at 6:00pm. 

Ndack needs this loan to increase her stock and better serve her customers. She helps her husband manage their daily expenses and her children's school fees. In the future, she wants to expand her business with the help of UIMCEC in order to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes which she resells to her customers.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 38 years old and married, from the village of Mejvriskhevi. She lives with her husband, two school-age children, and parents-in-law. 

The family has income from its agricultural activities. Specifically, they grow various of fruits on family-owned land and sell the harvest at the local open market.  The total amount of the monthly income is nearly $140, which is hardly enough for the family of six.  

Given her situation, Tamar lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Tamar to get a loan of US$ 3,000 and start a retail  business.  She will purchase all the needed construction materials to build a store and buy a stock of merchandise, such as groceries. 

Tamar will start up a grocery store.  She thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. After the store is opened, the family will have a stable income that will enable it to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.  

With support of the Start Up program, Tamar will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en:
Roeurn is 61 years old and married.  She is a farmer who does rice cropping on three hectares as the core income-generating activity for her entire family. Currently, she can earn up to KHR 22,500 per day. 

This is the first loan for Roeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking KHR 61,000 in order to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can boost her yield on time and make a good profit to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Rama

texts.fr: Rama est une femme âgée de 56ans qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans l’embouche bovine et a une expérience de plus de 20ans dans cette activité. C’est une habituée du Guichet elle y vient souvent pour épargner et prendre des crédits d’ailleurs elle est à son 4ème prêt et n’a jamais eu de problèmes de remboursement. Elle commence sa journée à 6h du matin pour ne revenir à la maison qu’à 20h du soir. Elle a besoin de ce montant pour augmenter son cheptel. Ainsi elle pourra diversifier ses produits pour épargner et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. A l’avenir elle souhaite ouvrir une ferme.
texts.en:
Rama is a 56-year-old married mother. She works in livestock fattening and has over 20 years experience in this business. She is a regular at her local UIMCEC branch and comes often to deposit her savings and apply for credit. She is on her fourth loan and has never had any problems with repayment. 

Rama starts her day at 6:00am and does not return home until 8:00pm. She needs this loan to increase her herd, which will allow her to diversify her savings products and improve her family's nutritional conditions. In the future, she would like to open a farm.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Hariri

texts.en:
Hariri is a married man and has seven children, five in school and two under school age.  He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, he has operated a fish-selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and town dwellers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation. 

Hariri is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Gorety

texts.en:
Gorety is 44 years old and married to Gidion.  They have four children, who are in school.

She has a boutique in Naivasha that she has operated for five years.  Now she has applied for a fourth loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy more stock of clothes for sale. 

She plans to pay school fees with anticipated profit. In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest boutique in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothes to sell

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 46-years-old .  She is married and has two children aged 20 and 17. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Kiva partner Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Shanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is widowed with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She makes candles from a shop that she rents. She sells her products to all kinds of people at the market. She has been in business for three years and she works six days a week.   She has applied for a loan of Ugandan shillings 400,000 from MCDTSACCO in order to buy a box of wax for making candles. Her major business challenges include seasonality and lack of market. She aspires to increase her sales so that she can buy a machine for making quality candles.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more wax for making candles.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is a 55-year-old woman from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  

She is also a farmer, and she plans to reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en: Ang, a rural villager from Pursat province's Sampov Meas district, is 41 years old. She has earned a living through pig-raising, selling groceries, and playing traditional music during traditional weddings. She is a widowed mother of seven children. Ang is able to earn about 29,200 KHR per day from her current business. This is Ang's first loan with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She teamed up with a group of five members to get a new loan. The total amount that her group is requesting is 4,500,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy pig feed and piglets, and to buy grocery items for her grocery store. She hopes to increase her income to expand her grocery store so that she can build a comfortable house.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy four more washing machines

loans.name: Yakhya

texts.fr: Monsieur YAKHYA  est un jeune homme qui est âgé  de 24 ans et qui habite à quelques kilomètres du Guichet. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants, il évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus Bazin dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais scolaires de ses enfants.  YAKHYA a une expérience de plus de 10 ans  dans cette activité. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h. Il a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter des tissus Bazin qu’il revendre à ses clients. A l’avenir il souhaite développer son commerce pour pouvoir épargner et augmenter ses revenus, de ce fait il pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille
texts.en:
Yakhya is a 24-year-old married father of two children who lives a few kilometers from his local UIMCEC branch. He sells damask cloth at weekly markets in order to manage the daily expenses of his family and pay his children's school fees. Yakhya has over 10 years experience in this business. He starts his day at 8:00am and finishes at 8:00pm.

Yakhya needs this loan to buy damask cloth to resell to his customers. In the future, he wants to grow his business in order to increase his revenues and save more money, thereby improving the living conditions of his small family.

loans.use: to purchase damask cloth which he resells in weekly markets

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a married, 27-year-old businessman in Thika. He is married to Judith who runs a salon business. Samuel operates a motorcycle transport business. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. This marks his fifth loan term with Kiva partner KADET. 

With the loan he has applied for from KADET Ltd. he will be able to purchase a used motorcycle. The additional income created will allow him to reinvest into the business and repay his loan. In the future, Elijah would like to be an employer and create business opportunities for jobless youths in his region. 

He hopes to become an established business man.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Sokkoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Sokkhoeurn is a 39-year-old mother of two school children and she is originally from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province.  Her sole business, which provides decent income to cover daily expenses, is three hectares of corn and bean farming.  She has been involved in her current business for ages.

This is the fifth cycled-loan for Sokkhoeurn with VisionFund  (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loan wisely to expand her business and keep her kids in school. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crop.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, a 39-year-old married mother of three from Embu, has a business as a dairy farmer. She also sells shoes to supplement her income. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to support her family. This marks her first loan term with Kiva partner KADET after she was introduced by an existing KADET client. 

With the loan she has applied for from KADET Ltd. Margaret will be able to purchase another dairy cow. The additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family and reinvest the remaining amount in her business. In the future, Margaret would like to buy more dairy cows. 

She hopes to save money to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married, 35-year-old businessman in Thika. He is married to Lucy and together they are blessed with two young children. Samuel operates a motorcycle transport business. He earns a monthly income of KES 17,500 which he uses to support his family. This marks his first loan term with Kiva partner KADET. 

With the loan he has applied for from KADET Ltd. he will be able to purchase a secondhand motorcycle. The additional income created will allow him to reinvest into the business and repay his loan. In the future, Samuel would like to be an employer and create business opportunities for jobless youths in his area. 

He hopes to become an established businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: MATAR est un homme qui a 45ans. Il est marié et père de  02 enfants, il évolue dans le transport et a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans l’activité.  C’est un fidèle client du Guichet qui est à son 4ème  prêt. Il a besoin de ce montant pour acheter une moto Djakarta pour faire le transport de moto qui est très choisi dans sa commune. MATAR commence sa journée à 08 pour la terminer à 20h. Il gère les charges quotidiennes de sa famille. A l’avenir il souhaite augmenter son parc de moto Djakarta pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Matar is a 45-year-old married father of two children. He works in transport and has over five years experience in this business. He is a loyal client of his local UIMCEC branch, and this is his fourth loan. He needs this loan to buy a Djakarta motorcycle, which is a common method of transportation in his area. Matar begins his day at 8:00 and finishes at 8:00pm. He manages the daily expenses of his family. In the future, he hopes to increase his fleet of Jakarta motorcycles in order to increase his revenues and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a Djakarta motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Erika Del Carmen

texts.es: Erika tiene la edad de 32 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos menores de edad que estudian en un colegio público de Managua. Erika se dedica a la venta casa por casa de cerdo frito, atol y verduras. Este negocio genera los ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Solicita el crédito para compra de maíz para la elaboración de atol, en aprovechamiento que en invierno el precio del maíz baja y puede vender mas atoles y maiz cocido a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Erika is 32 years old, and is a single mother of two dependent children who study in a public school in Managua. She works selling fried pork, atol [a traditional cornstarch-based hot drink, also known as atole], and vegetables house to house. This business provides her with the income she needs to support her family. 

She is seeking a loan to buy corn to make atol, taking advantage of the fact that in winter the price of corn falls and she can sell more atol and cooked corn to her clients.

loans.use: to buy corn and vegetables.

loans.name: Franklin Jonathan

texts.es:
El Joven Franklin  de 26  años   de edad, vive con su esposa, tiene 02  hijos que dependen de él y  vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05  años  a la venta de leche de manera ambulante.
Franklin  viaja desde su comunidad a la ciudad de San Lorenzo en su bicicleta con una porra llena de leche para vender  en las aldeas y caseríos de la ciudad, es un joven trabajador con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia y es un ejemplo de dedicación y esmero para otras personas.
Franklin está  solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de  leche para cuajar y también para venderla en liquido, con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su condición de vida, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma, es su tercer préstamo que solicita.
Franklin su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Franklin is a young man 26 years of age.  He lives with his wife and has 2 children who depend on him.  He lives in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  He has his own house, and for the past 5 years, he has made his living selling milk door to door.

Franklin travels from his community to the city of San Lorenzo on his bicycle with a large canister full of milk to sell in the small towns and villages surrounding the city. 

He is a hardworking young man with desires to get his family ahead.  He is an example for other people of dedication and caring.

Franklin is applying for the loan to buy milk for curdling and also for selling in liquid form.  With the support of this loan, he hopes to improve his earnings and also his living conditions.  He is very happy to continue working with Prisma.  This is his third loan.  Franklin's dream is to improve his house.

loans.use: to buy milk for his business.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en: This time, Venus is applying a new loan of Php 30,000 in order to purchase more sacks of peanuts. His variety store and food production business were previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF to continue and provide for Venus and his family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of peanuts to offer to sell.

loans.name: Arodie

texts.en: Arodie is a 49-year-old woman from Muhanga District in the Southern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of RWF 60,000  in order to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business.

loans.use: to pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 31-years-old. He is married with three children aged between one and eight years. He has been working as a potato farmer for the past 12 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use in potato production. The profits from the potatoes will be used to provide food for the family.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for better produce.

loans.name: Fatou Gueye

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  née en 1979 fait du commerce depuis 03 ans. Elle achète pour revendre des glacières, nattes, bols, draps et rideaux. Elle exerce cette activité en permanence mais à l’habitude  de réduire ou d’augmenter la quantité de ses achats compte tenu de la période. Elle commence sa journée à 09h pour la terminer à 18h. Et vu que la période de la chaleur approche, elle va diversifier les produits en achetant des produits adaptés à l’été. Fatou es t mariée mais à part ses charges personnelles, elle n’a en pas d’autres. Actuellement  ce qu’elle aimerait le plus c’est  d’ouvrir une autre cantine dans le marché.
texts.en: Fatou was born in 1979 and has been trading iceboxes, mats, bowls, bedding and curtains for three years. It is her regular job, but she reduces or increases her number of purchases depending on the time of year. Knowing that the hottest time of year is approaching, Fatou would like to diversify her stock by purchasing products suitable for summer. She starts her day at 9:00am and finishes at 6:00pm. Fatou is married, but besides her personal expenses, she does not have other major financial obligations. In the future, she would like to open another canteen in the market.

loans.use: to purchase iceboxes, mats, bowls, bedding and curtains for resale.

loans.name: Yurbady

texts.es: Yurbady de 59 años,  habita al suroccidente de la ciudad lugar donde se dedica  la venta de productos de aseo, como trapero, jabón, escoba y desinfectante. Desde muy joven se dedicó al comercio de productos y hoy tiene su pequeño almacén que es su principal proveedor, quien le ofrece artículos a precios especiales y esto hace mucho más efectivo su trabajo. Yurbady vende puerta a puerta, a los vecinos de su barrio y en otros aledaños, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de lunes a sábados, para aumentar cada vez más sus ingresos. Su metra es hacer crecer su inventario y este es justamente el propósito de acudir a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen productos de aseo, con ello aumentará sus inventarios y podrá responder a los pedidos de su distinguida clientela, saliéndole al frente a la competencia que es su mayor desafío.
texts.en:
Yurbady is 59 years old and lives in the southwest part of the city where she sells cleaning products such as mops, soap, brooms, and disinfectant.  Ever since she was young she was involved in commerce and today she has a small store which is her main source of supply.  She gets products at good prices and this makes her work much more profitable. 

From 8 in the morning until 6 at night, Monday through Saturday, Yurbady sells door-to-door to her neighbors and to people in the surrounding areas to constantly increase her income.  Her goal is to increase her inventory and this is exactly the reason why she is asking for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she is requesting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With the money, she will buy cleaning products in greater quantities, increase her inventories and be more responsive to her distinguished customers, putting her ahead of the competition which is her greatest challenge.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products in greater quantities.

loans.name: Ingrid Patricia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Ingrid, quien con su credikiva compró al por mayor y de contado, discos compactos para la venta, gorros, camisetas y artículos deportivos. Con su anterior credikiva, logró aumentar su capital de trabajo su inventario de mercancía variada y sus ventas y utilidades. Con este crédito ha mejorado sus ingresos familiares,  pues su clientela fue cada vez mayor. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, les agradezco seguir apoyándome financieramente para continuar progresando. “ En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, con el que comprará gafas, camisas, C.D. DVD, gorros y camisetas de navidad en la temporada que se acerca que es de mayor movimiento comercial e impacta sus ventas.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Ingrid, who, with her Kiva loan, bought wholesale and in cash, compact discs to sell, caps, t-shirts and sporting items.

With her previous Kiva loan, she was able to increase her working capital, her inventory of assorted merchandise, and her sales and profits.  With this loan, her family income has improved and her customers have increased.

She says to her Kiva lenders, "Many thanks to Kiva and to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  I appreciate you continuing to support me financially so that I can continue to progress."

She is currently applying for a new loan, with which she will buy sunglasses, shirts, CDs, DVDs, caps and Christmas t-shirts in the upcoming season, which is has the greatest commercial activity and impact on her sales.

loans.use: to buy sunglasses, shirts, CDs, DVDs, caps and Christmas t-shirts.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 44 years old. She is married and has six children, aged between seven and twenty. She has been a potato grower for the past twenty years. She has requested a loan, which she will use to buy more fertilizer and quality seed for use during the time of potato production. With the profits from the produce, she will reinvest in the potato growing business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seed, for use during potato production season.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.ru:
Наталья торгует женской одеждой. Несмотря на ее небольшой опыт (3 года), дела у нее идут хорошо. Благодаря предыдущему КИВА кредиту Наталья смога увеличить товарооборот и получить дополнительную прибыль.

Недавно семья Натальи увеличилась. Она родила ребенка. Несмотря на то, что хлопот добавилось, Наталья продолжает заниматься бизнесом, т.к. это основной доход для ее семьи.

Наталья просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку осеннего и зимнего товара в размере 22,000 гривен. Как и в прошлый раз, она надеется увеличить объем продаж и соответственно свою прибыль.
texts.en:
Natalia sells women's clothing.  Despite her limited experience of only three years, she is doing very well.  Thanks to the last loan from Kiva, Natalia was able to increase her product turnover, ultimately increasing her profit.  Recently, Natalia's family has grown in size.  She gave birth to a child.  Despite the added hassle, Natalia is continuing to run her business since it is the the main source of income for her family.

Natalia is asking for a loan of 22,000 hryvni so she can expand her clothing inventory for the fall and winter seasons.  Just like the last time, she is hoping to increase her sale volume, thus, increasing her profit.

loans.use: To expand her clothing inventory for the fall and winter seasons.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome, a 43-year-old, single mother of two in Mwingi, earns a living for her family by selling clothes. Due to having limited income to fund her business, she has been unable to expand her business. That is why she decided to request a loan from KADET. She will use the loan to purchase more bales of clothes, and thus, she will expand her customer base. This, in turn, will increase her sales and increase her profits, too. 

Currently, her business gives her a monthly income of KES 11,000. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, Salome will save for her children’s education and repay her loan. 

In future, Salome would like to purchase a piece of land and construct a permanent, residential house for her family there.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes

loans.name: Wangui

texts.en:
Wangui, a 71-year-old widowed mother of five grown up children from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support herself and her grandchildren. This marks her second loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loan successfully. 

With the loan she has applied for at KADET Ltd., she will be able to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm. The additional income created will allow her to reinvest in her farming business. In the future, Wangui would like to buy more dairy cows. 

She hopes to have a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, a 42-year-old married mother of three from Thika, earns a living for her family by operating a tailoring shop. She has been in this business for the past five years, and earns a monthly income of KES 5,400 which she uses to support her family. This marks her first loan from KADET LTD. 

She intends to use the loan to purchase more fabric to make clothes for her customers. The additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family, and invest in her children’s education. 

She hopes to save money to educate her children to the college level, and to purchase a piece of land to construct a residential house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Abdias

texts.en: Abdias is a 46-year-old man from Muhanga district in the southern province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of  RWF 60,000 to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  He is also a carpenter and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 rechargeable, low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 49 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for their family.

Rosalina runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for six years.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Radika

texts.en:
Radika is 50 years old.  She is married and has three children, aged 30, 27 and 21. Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy seed and fertilizer for her business.  In the future, Radika plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seed and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her vegetable farming business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is married with one child and she goes to school. She has no additional family members. She sells second-hand shoes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works six days a week.

She applied for a loan of Uganda Shillings 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bale of second hand shoes. Her major business challenges includes seasonality (rainy season), which hinders her movements and transportation. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. 

Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used shoes.

loans.name: Fariza

texts.ru: Фариза вместе со своей семьей живет в отдаленном регионе. Она 3 года назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей одежды и обуви. Вначале она взяла деньги у родственника, но ей было очень трудно оплатить долг. Постепенно она развевала свой бизнес и оплатила долг. Она торгует на местном рынке, где имеет торговую точку. Она покупает товар оптом с и реализует в розницу. Она является основной кормилицей в семье. Фариза хочет пополнить оборотный капитал в осенний сезон. С такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки одежды и обуви. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Fariza, along with her family, lives in a remote mountain region.  Three years ago, she started her own business of selling clothing and shoes.  In the beginning, she borrowed money from her relatives, however it was very difficult for her to pay back the debt.  Steadily, she expanded her business and repaid the loan.  She sells her goods at the local market, where she has a stall.  She purchases her inventory wholesale and sells it retail.  She is the breadwinner in her family.  

Fariza wishes to increase her working capital for the fall season.  She is asking for a loan of 1000 USD to purchase clothing items and shoes for resale.  She is waiting for your kindness and is hoping for your generosity.

loans.use: To purchase clothing items and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 36 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for six years, and she earns additional income by raising ducks.

Rhodora is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase pesticide and other farming supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pesticide and other farming supplies

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 25-year-old businessman in Embu who is married to Lilian. They are blessed with one child, who is a year old. He runs a business of selling assorted goods, and his wife runs a retail shop. He currently lacks funds to purchase enough goods to serve his ever-growing customer base. 

With a loan through KADET LTD, James will be able to purchase more wrist watches, radios, cups, jugs, and thermos flasks. James is requesting his third loan from KADET LTD, having successfully cleared his previous loans. The additional income created will allow him to invest in a motorcycle transport business, and also to educate his child. 

In the future, James would like to be a very successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase more wrist watches, radios, cups, jugs, and thermos flasks.

loans.name: Diana Paulina

texts.es: Diana, a sus 26 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 5 años y cabeza de hogar, debido a que es separada. Actualmente se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una tienda donde ofrece productos de belleza que inició hace aproximadamente 3 meses. Ella aprendió la labor de manera empírica, por el método de prueba/ error y, de esta forma ha ido adquiriendo conocimientos en cuanto al manejo de su negocio. Trabaja sola todos los días de 9:00 am a 8:00 pm, excepto los domingos que trabaja hasta el medio día y de esta manera genera los recursos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar y la manutención de su pequeño hijo. La cliente se caracteriza por ser una mujer pujante, dinámica y emprendedora, siempre va en busca de nuevas oportunidades que le ayuden a progresar. Esto la motiva para solicitar el apoyo del crédito con la intención de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (tintes, tratamientos capilares, cosméticos, esmaltes y artículos de decoración para uñas, entre otros) y realizar unas adecuaciones al local; así le dará una mejor imagen al establecimiento y podrá atraer más clientes, a los cuales podrá ofrecer una mayor variedad de artículos que satisfagan los diversos gustos y necesidades; todo esto se verá reflejado en el incremento de las ventas y por ende de sus ingresos, con los que podrá seguir velando por el bienestar de su hijo. Diana sueña con adquirir un local propio y de esta forma tendrá la oportunidad de seguir avanzando y fortalecer su negocio, pues desea expandirse y abrir más sucursales a mediano plazo; por el momento es consciente que debe trabajar con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, de esta forma podrá garantizar que su negocio sea rentable y poder tener una estabilidad económica favorable, que le garantice la posibilidad de brindar un mejor bienestar y educación a su pequeño hijo y mejorar la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana at 26 years old, is the mother of a five year old child and is the head of the household, as she is separated. She runs her own business, a store that offers beauty products which she started 3 months ago. She learned this work by doing it, by trial and error. She has gained some experience as to how to manage her business. She works alone every day from 9 am to 8 pm except Sunday when she stops at noon.
