Toda su vida ha vivido en el área rural, donde aprendió las labores del campo y gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de café, ganado de levante y cría de cerdos, con esto genera los recursos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Con esmero y dedicación ha sabido sobrepasar diversos obstáculos que se le presentan, especialmente con los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas y de los productos veterinarios que requiere para cuidar a sus animales, sin embargo, esto no la detiene, pues con su espíritu emprendedor siempre encuentra la forma de seguir avanzando. Esto la lleva a solicitar el crédito como apoyo para darle continuidad a su actividad, con el dinero comprará terneras de levante y lechones para cría y engorde, para luego venderlos, de esta manera podrá aumentar su producción y mejorará la entrada de recursos económicos al hogar, permitiendo tener la oportunidad de fortalecer su negocio y poco a poco ir logrando una producción escalonada que le garantice recibir ingresos de manera constante, para seguir velando por el bienestar de sus hijos y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María's a mother and the head of her household.  She has four children whom she has gotten ahead with a lot of effort.  She has lived her whole life in a rural area where she learned farm labor.  Thanks to that, today she has coffee crops and cattle and pigs to raise with which she earns the money to pay for her household's basic needs.

With care and dedication María has been able to overcome various obstacles that have come up, especially with the high cost of agricultural inputs and the veterinary products she needs to take care of her animals.  This doesn't hold her back, though, because with her enterprising spirit she always finds a way to continue making progress.

This brings María to request the loan as support for continuing with her job.  With the money she'll buy calves and piglets to raise and fatten for later sale.

She'll be able to increase her production and improve the household income, which will allow her to strengthen her business and stagger production to guarantee that she constantly has money coming in.  This way she can continue to look out for the welfare of her children and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy calves and piglets

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
41-year-old Theresa is from Liberia. She lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has seven children aged between 3 and 24; they all live with her and are attending school. 

For eight years now she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She sells from morning to afternoon time six days of the week. She has a regular group of customers that visit her table for new merchandise among her used clothes. She gives goods on credit to some customers and collects the money later; most interestingly she makes her own money. 

Theresa has requested a loan to purchase more used clothes. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life. She thanks BRAC Liberia for their continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes.

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadia was born in 1972.  She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Because Nadia is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture.

Her husband is a retired man who is currently running a cellphone shop that he rented. He has been running it for six years, and Nadia helps him with it. This project has helped them cover their needs, as it has been profitable for them. 

Nadia and her husband are planning to add new products to their project, like mobile-phone accessories and mobile credit cards, in order to attract more customers and raise their sales. To do so, Nadia has applied for this loan to buy them, as they don’t have enough money for them.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories and mobile credit cards to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 29 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has two children, aged 9 and 12, who are presently in school and live at home. Catherine completed 8th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a hard-working woman.  

For the past 3 years, Catherine has been selling frozen chicken in the local market. She sells six days a week, from 8am to 9pm. She likes how fast her customers buy from her. She started this business by selling for her mother. She uses a taxi to get her stock. 

Catherine is requesting a loan to purchase more frozen chicken for her business. She plans to build a house and to educate her children. She'd like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia Microfinance Company Limited.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen chicken for her business.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh s’active dans l’agriculture depuis plus de 10 ans maintenant. Il loge dans un petit village situé à environ 30km de la ville principale. Cheikh est un habitué du guichet, car il en est à son quatrième crédit à l’IMCEC. Il fait du maraichage et a besoin d’un renouvellement de prêt afin de pouvoir acheter des semences et de cultiver son champ.
Avec les revenus de son activité, Cheikh peut s’occuper de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille, améliorer leurs conditions alimentaires  et mettre désormais un peu d’argent de coté pour prévoir les imprévus. Il rêve de construire une maison pour mettre à l’aise sa famille.
Comme projet futur il veut exploiter d’autres périmètres culturaux pour maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Cheikh has been active in agriculture for over ten years now. He lives in a small village about 30 km from the main city. Cheikh is a regular at the local branch, as he is on his fourth loan with IMCEC. He has been growing produce for sale, and is in need of a loan renewal in order to buy seeds and cultivate his field.

With the income from his business, Cheikh will be able to take care of the daily expenses of his family and improve their nutrition. He will also put some money aside in case of unexpected expenses. His dream is to build a house for his family to make them comfortable. As a future project he wants to pursue other farming ventures to maximize his income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds so that he can cultivate his field.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Thelma works hard to support her family.

She has a 'buy and sell' rice grains business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and raising livestock. Thelma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her  business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 22 years old and comes from the Baghdati district. He lives with his wife, parents, two brothers, a daughter-in-law and his grandfather. His grandfather is provided with a retirement pension. Zviad and his brother work at a local petrol station and get a small monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a vineyard and produce and sell wine. They work hard and always have high quality wine, which is sold to local retailers for a good price. 

 As the family has only seasonal income, Zviad decided to start his own business and seek for credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 2500 Gel.

 With the received credit, Zviad will build a greenhouse. He will purchase building materials and seeds of cucumbers and tomatoes. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased by the kind help of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 32 years old and married, with three children, two of whom are in school.

Yvonne earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to pay for laborers' salaries during harvest and to buy new rice seeds.

Yvonne has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries during harvest and to buy new rice seeds.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 30 years old and a high school graduate. She lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has a three-year-old child. Her child is attending school and living at home.  She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

Over the past three years she has been selling used clothes. She spends six hours each day selling. She likes her business because of the popularity she has achieved over the years. She started this business with money given to her by her mother; she uses a taxi most of the time to buy her goods.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. 

Catherine's  plan is to build a house and become a big businesswoman.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is from Yerevan where he lives with his wife and two little children. A year ago he rented a small booth where he makes different types of shoes for men and women. He works hard to sustain his family's living.

Now due to poor living conditions, Hovhannes isn't able to purchase materials for making shoes. So, he has applied for this loan for help. Hovhannes has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan will be a great support for Hovhannes to be able to purchase leather and other materials for tailoring shoes. Thus, he will be able to earn income and cover his family's living expenses. 

Hovhannes waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for leather and other materials for making shoes by hand

loans.name: Ana Arely

texts.es: Doña Ana de 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, Ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace mas de 10 años, es una persona respetuosa, educada, responsable, y muy servicial, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores donde ella vive, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Ana solicita un crédito un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes,  herramientas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía, para poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 33 years old and lives in her own home with her life companion and their three children.  She has been growing corn and beans for more than 10 years.  Ana is respectful, educated, and responsible person who is very service-oriented.  She sells her products in the surrounding neighborhoods near where she lives.  By working in this manner, she is able to cover many of her family’s expenses.  

Doña Ana is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies for corn and bean crops such as seeds, compost, fertilizers, tools, and other items, such as the ones shown in the photograph.  This will enable her to improve her income and the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, tools, and other items.

loans.name: Atilano Tobias

texts.es: Atilano Tobias se dedica a la producción de café desde que era pequeño pues su padre también se dedicaba a esta actividad y le enseñó a él y a sus hermanos todo lo relacionado con el cultivo de esta planta. Cuando Atilano Tobias se casó se independizó de su padre y junto con su esposa comenzaron a forjar su futuro en base a esta actividad. Para esta cosecha necesita un crédito para pagar a los cortadores que contratará para trabajar en su finca y realizar algunas labores de limpieza. Además de producir café también se dedica a la producción de caña que es otra de las principales actividades económicas en su localidad.
texts.en: Atilano Tobias has been making a living producing coffee since he was a young boy, as his father also worked in this area and taught Atilano and his siblings the trade.  When Atilano married, he stopped depending on his father and, alongside his wife, they started to forge out a future for themselves, with coffee as its foundation.  For this harvest, Atilano needs a loan to pay the cutters, who he will employ to work on the farm,and to do some cleaning work.  In addition to producing coffee, Atilano earns a living growing sugar cane, another important trade in the town.

loans.use: to pay the cutters and to clean the farm.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita works hard to support her family. Warlita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Warlita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, paint, bamboo, etc. She has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat like wood, paint, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Finda

texts.en:
Finda is 40 years old, single with an 18-year-old child who is in school and living at home in the West Point area, one of the most populated and best-known markets in Montserrado County that is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She did not attend school, and has been selling palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc. in the local market over the past three years. 

Finda is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc. She uses a taxi most of the time; she really faces problems during the rainy season because she does not have a good selling spot in the local market. She is grateful for her business because she makes more money from her business. Her plan is to build a house for her child.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: El Naranjo Group

texts.es: Marcelo, tiene, 29 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de El Progreso, Yoro. Tiene aproximadamente 20 años  de dedicarse a la agricultura de hortalizas como ser: culantro, perejil, frijoles, maíz, apio, entre otros. La producción es vendida en la misma zona, siendo esta actividad su fuente de ingresos. Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo de forma grupal, el grupo se llama El Naranjo que esta formado por 7 miembros, todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. El monto total de préstamo del grupo es por 50,000 Lempiras. Este préstamo lo han solicitado para comprar postes y materiales que necesitan   para el  proyecto de electrificación en su aldea  con el fin de poder impulsar el desarrollo en la comunidad y mejorar sus condiciones de vida. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda Marcelo de camisa cuadriculada, sigue santos, luego José Donaldo, Lucia, José Leonilo, Andrés a la derecha de camiseta verde, y Marvin no salió en la foto.
texts.en: Marcelo is 29 years old and married.  He has two children and lives in a village that is part of the town of El Progreso, in Yoro.  For some twenty years Marcelo has been making a living growing herbs and vegetables, such as cilantro, parsley, beans, corn, and other items.  What he produces, Marcelo sells in the area and this work is a source of income for him.  He is currently applying for a group loan.  The group, made up of seven members from the same community and all working in agriculture, is called "El Naranjo".  The total loan amount is 50,000 Lempira.  The group have applied for the loan in order to buy posts and other materials that they need in order to bring electricity to the village.  The aim of this is to drive development in the community and to improve living conditions.  In the photo, Marcelo is on the left.  Moving along to the right are Santos, José Donaldo, Lucia, José Leonilo, and Andrés.  Marvin was not there when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy posts and other materials to bring electricity to the area.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: María Elsa es una señora que trabaja a diario  para ganarse la vida, ella es viuda desde hace muchos años. Se dedica a vender de manera ambulante en diferentes rutas, espejos, cuadros y camas los cuales elabora con el apoyo de sus hijos. Solicita el crédito para comprar la materia prima como madera, resina, pintura, cal, tornillos, marcos, pega, talco blanco entre otros  que le permitan elaborar sus productos y continuar las ventas al crédito. De esta manera María Elsa mantiene sus gastos principales del hogar.
texts.en: María Elsa works every day in order to earn a living.  She has been a widow for many years.  She makes a living selling, mirrors, frames, and beds, which she makes with her children's help.  María sells on different roads in the city.  María is applying for a loan to buy basic supplies such as wood, resin, paint, lime, screws, frames, glue, talcum powder, and more.  These supplies will allow her to make her products and continue to sell them on credit.  With this María can cover the main household costs.

loans.use: to buy wood, resin, paint, lime, glue, screws, and frames.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 43 years old, married to Richard, and supports a family of six members. Her children are between the ages of seven and seventeen. She is a maize farmer and she has been in the business for the last ten years. Her monthly income is KES 16,000.

 She is currently requesting her first loan from KADET of Kes 30,000 that will facilitate the harvesting of her maize and transporting it to the market. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and develop her plot. Juliet's dream is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: pay for harvesting, labour, and transport of her produce

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix casado más de 34 años, tienen 1 hijo dependiente que estudia en nivel secundaria, la familia es humilde viven en la comunidad de Colomi, son agricultores, anualmente tienen ingresos económicos por la venta estacional de papa, haba, oca, como también cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno 3 de engorde más 1 lechera. El señor Félix solicita un crédito para construcción de una vivienda económica ya que el ahorro que tenían no les alcanzo por que invirtieron en compra de insumos agrícolas. Por ultimo don Félix y su esposa tendrán una vivienda para vivir cómodamente cerca a su chaco donde también tiene su labor agrícola.
texts.en: Félix has been married for over 34 years and has one son that is still dependent on his parents - he is attending high school.  This is a humble family and, living in the Colomi community, they are farmers.  Every year the family earns money through seasonal sales of potatoes, broad beans, and oca.  The family also has three cows for fattening up, and one dairy cow.  Félix is applying for a loan in order to buy an cheap house.  He has savings but not enough as he invested in farming supplies.  With the house, Félix and his wife will have a home where they can live comfortably and near where they work.

loans.use: to build a home.

loans.name: Abdala

texts.en: Abdala lives in the Mariakani area where he does his business. He has been operating a butcher shop for the last two years and his business has really grown. He started the business from personal savings that he had made. He learned about Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy a freezer for storage of the meat. His long term ambition is to have branches of his business spread all over despite the usual challenges of high fuel and transportation costs. The extra income that he will raise will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es una persona muy emprendedora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su familia que está conformada por sus padres y  hermanos, hace varios años se dedica a su propio negocio que es una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clienta por la variedad de productos que tiene y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos de su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: huevos, golosinas, sopas, aceite, refrescos, verduras, etc. para poder abastecer su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This borrower is a very enterprising and responsible person.  She lives in her own home with her family, which consists of her parents and her siblings.  For several years she has been managing her own business, which is a store that is located in her home.  She has many customers because she offers a variety of products at good prices.  With what she earns from her business, she is able to pay for some of the household expenses.  

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as eggs, snack foods, soups, oil, soft drinks, vegetables, and other products so that she can restock her business and satisfy the needs of her customers.  She hopes to provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eggs, snack foods, soups, oil, soft drinks, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en:
Leonidas is 53 years old. He is the father of five children. 

He has been a potato farmer for the past five years. He has requested a loan to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the potatoes he produces will be used to help in providing family needs.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for growing potatoes

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is 48 years old and married, and he supports a family of six members. 

He has been a potato farmer in the Mau Narok area of Kenya for the past 18 years, getting a monthly income of KES 33,000. With a third loan of KES 20,000 from KADET, Haron intends to acquire farm inputs and pay for labor for spraying his potato crop.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His dream is to uplift his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for his potato farm

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha was born in 1988. She is married and is a mother of two children. Her husband is in the military. 

Aysha has been selling sheep and their products for one year. She started her business with a small quantity of sheep. Then she expanded it slowly, over time. Her business was a good source of income which is helping her in supporting her husband and children. 

Now, she is seeking to buy more sheep to be more productive and to expand her income. But, she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to increase her business productivity.

loans.name: Danaya (Confiance) Group

texts.fr:
Danaya est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les condiments, les fruits et légumes, du savon, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe. 
Awa  est un membre du groupe Danaya assise devant de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des savons (pour toilettes, lessives). Elle se procure de ces produits au grand marché de Koutiala avec les ghanéens. Elle vend ces articles en détail et au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle exclusivement féminine. 
Mme Awa  compte réaliser  30.000FCFA de bénéfice mensuel au cours de ce cycle. En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
Danaya is an organization of women from Koutiala who know each other well and who live in traditional larger families with their husbands, children, and other parents. They have an average age of 37 years, are married, and have at least 4 children each. The women in the group are in various businesses, including spices, fruits, vegetables, soaps, etc.

In order to increase the size of their businesses, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their second group loan. 

Awa, a member of the Danaya group, is pictured seated in front, on the left hand side. She plans to use her loan to purchase soaps (for bathing and laundry.) She obtains these products in the big market in Koutiala from Ghanaian sellers. She sells them at retail for cash from her house and in the market to a customer base made up exclusively of women. Awa hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA during this loan period. In additional to paying back the interest, the group will use a portion of the profits earned to provide for their personal needs and increase their business capital.

loans.use: to purchase soaps

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 55 years old, is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She supports the family through the income she earns from selling soft drinks. She began this business five years ago. Her husband runs a business of repairing and selling old watches. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Yen intends to take a loan to increase her working capital so she can buy many kinds of soft drinks for selling. She hope that this will enable her to increase sales. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks for selling at her store.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Blanca es casada y madre de tres hijos. Toda su vida ha sido ama de casa, pero desde hace 3 años decidió montar su propio negocio, con el fin de aportar a la economía de su hogar. Inició una tienda ubicada cerca de la casa donde reside, lo que le permite estar pendiente de todo lo de su hogar, además tiene la ventaja de facilitar el desplazamiento. En el establecimiento ofrece gaseosas, mecato, productos de aseo, entre otros, sin embargo hay muchos productos que le pide su clientela y ella no los tiene debido a la falta de capital de trabajo, por lo que ha perdido algunas ventas. Esto la lleva a solicitar el crédito como apoyo para continuar con su negocio, con el dinero desea comprar surtido de abarrotes al por mayor (granos, pastas, arroz, lácteos, huevos, entre otros), con lo que tendrá la posibilidad de ampliar su inventario y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos, lo que se reflejará directamente en el incremento de las ventas y los ingresos que son el resultado de su labor. Blanca sueña con hacer crecer su negocio hasta convertirlo en un minimercado, con muy buen surtido y donde pueda seguir dando la oportunidad de empleo a su hijo menor quien le ha colaborado desde la apertura de la tienda, así espera generar más ingresos para brindar a su familia la posibilidad de disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Blanca is married and is the mother of three children. All of her life she has been a housewife, but 3 years ago she decided to set up her own business with the aim of contributing to the household finances. She opened up a shop near to where she lives, which allows her to look after everything at home as well as being easy to get to. In her shop she sells fizzy drinks, cakes and cleaning products among other things, but there are many products which her customers ask for which she does not have, due to a lack of working capital, so she has lost some sales. 

This has led her to ask for the loan as support for continuing with her business. With the money she wants to buy an assortment of groceries wholesale (pulses, pasta, rice, dairy products, eggs and other items), which will give her the opportunity to increase her range and give her customers a wider variety of products. This will be directly reflected in an increase in sales and the income she gets from her work. 

Blanca dreams of making her business grow into a minimarket, with a very good range, and where she can continue providing work for her younger son who has worked with her since the opening of the shop. In this way she hopes to generate more income so her family can enjoy better living conditions and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries wholesale (pulses, pasta, rice, dairy products, eggs and other items)

loans.name: Arta

texts.en:
This is Arta. She is a 37-year-old mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She is married and lives with her family in the rural southeastern part of the country. For the past ten years, she has been involved in agricultural activities, selling raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. In addition, just like the majority of rural residents in her area, she plants, harvests, and sells vegetables and grains to her city's local market.
 
Agriculture is the only source of income for her family, and both she and her husband are involved in it. Arta wants to buy fodder for the animals with this loan. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To buy fodder for the animals

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 38 years old and lives in West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has two children, ages 10 and 15. Her children attend school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Over the past three years she has been running a cook shop where she sells rice, fufu (made of cassava dough), and soup around the local market. She spends 14 hours each day working. She likes her business because of the popularity she has achieved over the years. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a taxi every time she needs to buy goods. She is asking for a loan to purchase more rice, fish, meat, pepper, oil, charcoal, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house and become a big business woman. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, fish, meat, pepper, oil, charcoal, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Desde que se casó Ana se ha dedicado a la producción de café, pues su esposo se dedicaba a esa actividad, sin embargo hace un año el esposo de Ana murió y ella quedó a cargo de todo el negocio. Sus hijos la ayudan a realizar algunas actividades en la finca, sin embargo como ya se acerca la cosecha Ana necesita un crédito pues como es mucho trabajo el que hay que realizar contratará cortadores de café y con ayuda del financiamiento les pagará. Pasando la cosecha a Ana le gustaría hacer algunos arreglos en la cocina de su casa, pues a ella le gusta mucho cocinar.
texts.en: Ana has worked in coffee production ever since she got married, since her husband already did this work. However, Ana's husband died a year ago and she was left in charge of the whole business. Her children help her to carry out some of the farm tasks, but as the harvest is approaching Ana needs a loan. Since there is a lot of work to be done she will hire coffee pickers and will pay them with the help of the loan. After the harvest Ana would like to make some improvements to the kitchen in her home, since she really enjoys cooking.

loans.use: to pay coffee pickers.

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en:
Peruth is 60 years old. She is married and has one child who is 19. She has been a farmer for the past 30 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use in the production of potatoes. The profits from the potatoes will be used to provide food and all basic needs for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and quality seeds

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 55 years old, married to Alice, and supports a family of ten members. His children are between the ages of 12 and 18.

He has been a potatoe farmer in the Enooseyia  area of Narok county, Kenya, for the last 20 years, getting a monthly income of KES 10,000. With a third loan of KES 40,000 from KADET, he intends to acquire farm inputs that includes fertilizer and pesticides. He will also pay for the labour charges.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his farm acreage. His future dream is to have a sustainable business.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and pay for labour

loans.name: Lialo

texts.en:
Lialo is 32 years old, married to Noonguta, and a father of three children, aged 5, 3, and 1 year old. 

He rears livestock in the lower Melili area of Narok county, Kenya and he has been in the livestock business for the last four years, earning a monthly income of KES 45,000. Lialo is servicing his fourth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), in the amount of KES 80,000, that he plans to use to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale at a gain.

Lialo intends to use the anticipated profits to add his animals’ numbers and to pay school fees for his children. His dreams are to prosper and to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattenning and resale.

loans.name: Mar Brava Group

texts.es: Patricio, quien aparece al costado derecho de la fotografía, agachado y de chaqueta de cuero negra, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mar Brava, de Castro, Chiloé. En este Banco Comunal, Mar Brava, la mayoría de sus socios venden en la feria, y algunos son peluqueros. Patricio vende joyas, esto hace ya más de 20 años, comenzó vendiendo oro, pero estaba muy caro así que cambio su rubro a venta de joyas, de oro, plata e hipoalergénicas y perfumes. Agradece siempre haber tenido éxito en sus ventas, ya que se ha hecho de una muy buena clientela. El dinero que está solicitando es para poder comprar más joyas. Espero que le vaya muy bien ya que ha tenido hartas solicitudes y no ha podido cumplir con ellas por falta de dinero. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de conocer gente que tiene sus mismas pretensiones en la vida, de poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Patricio appears on the right side of the photograph.  He is crouched down and wearing a black leather jacket.  Patricio is a member of the Communal Bank “Mar Brava”, which is located in Castro, Chiloé.  Most of the members of the “Mar Brava” Communal Bank sell at the fair, but some have hair salons.  

Patricio has been selling jewelry for more than 20 years.  He started out selling gold, but that business was too expensive to maintain so he switched to selling gold and silver jewelry, hypoallergenic products, and perfumes.  Patricio is grateful that he has always had success with his sales since he has built up a very good clientele.  The money he is requesting will be used to buy more jewelry.  He hopes to do very well since he is overloaded with requests, but he lacks the money to fulfill them.  

What he enjoys most about working with Fondo Esperanza is getting to know people who have the same aspirations in life and are able to move forward.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Bagrat

texts.en:
Bagrat is from Vanadzor town, where he has a retail clothing business; he has been involved in this business for ten years. He purchases clothing from the city market and sells it in nearby villages. 

Now he'd like to purchase a new stock of clothing for the autumn season, so Bagrat needs financial support. His income is hardly enough for covering the family's daily spending, so he is not able to save money for new stock.

Bagrat asks for a loan that will greatly assist him to purchase a new stock of clothing. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan is a great support for Bagrat, who is hardworking father of two grown up children.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 55 years old. He is a father of six children, and all his children are between 13 and 32. He has been a potatoe farmer for the past 20 years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds to use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the potatoe produce will be reinvested in the farming.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seeds to use during potatoe production

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 37 years old and married, with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. 

Anh runs a cafe for earning a living. She started her business ten years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different beverages to sell for her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more beverages to sell.

loans.name: Artan

texts.en:
Artan started to build a stable for his animals, yet he can’t finish it because he is short of money.  He is photographed in front of the unfinished stable.

“I had a very bad stable for the animals, covered with some cardboard," Artan said, "and the animals were sleeping under very bad conditions. And imagine, in our region the winters are extremely cold and snow. So I thought that building a brand new stable would help animals rest and sleep better.”  

The loan that he is applying for will help him achieve that.  Artan is 35 years old and has two school-aged children, 12 and 9 years old.

loans.use: to finish building a badly needed stable for his animals

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, 46, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Ha has been running a business of making garments and other products for five years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying different kinds of sewing materials to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Jartu

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Jartu from Liberia. She lives in West Point, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and has two children, ages 8 and 11. Both of her children are presently in school and live at home. She completed 12th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past six years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She sells six days each week, from 8am to 5pm. She likes her business because it is a fast-paced business. She started this business by selling rice for her mother. She uses a taxi most of the time to get her supply of used clothing. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothing for her business. She plans to build a house and attend a university. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes

loans.name: Conavi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Conavi está en su primer ciclo uno del programa de comité,  donde cada una de ellas quiere poder luchar por su familia, para poder darles la vida que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Corina quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación. Corina es tejedora y hace todo tipo de tejidos, tiene muy buen pedido de sus clientes y con este trabajo ella está saliendo adelante.
La Sra. Corina solicita de este crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus tejidos y cumpliendo con sus metas, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group “Conavi” is in its first loan cycle with the committee program.  The members all want to strive on behalf of their families so that they can give them the life that they were not able to have.  

One of the members is Sra. Corina.  Through her effort and continuous work, Corina puts into practice the vital behaviors that are exhibited by a successful woman.  She is in the process of improving her situation.  Corina is a weaver and makes all types of woven items.  She has many orders from her customers and her work enables her to get ahead.  

Sra. Corina is requesting a loan so that she can buy thread, needles, and other supplies so that she can continue producing her woven items and accomplishing her goals.  As a result, this will help to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel vive en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país tiene 43 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, chinelas, cosméticos, zapatos, también tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos de bicicleta, inició su negocio con la ayuda de su esposa, una sus sueños es poder mejorar sus negocios y estabilidad familiar para estar unidos y tener un mejor futuro, solicita crédito para la compra de capital de trabajo y poder obtener mejores ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, el agradece la ayuda y ala oportunidad que los Inversionista Kivas le ofrecen a personas con escasos recursos y países pobres como Nicaragua para tener un medio digno y honrado de trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel lives in the department of Chinandega in the west of the country. He is 43 years old and earns a living selling general merchandise such as clothing, slippers, cosmetics and shoes and also has a business selling bicycle spares. He set up his business with the help of his wife and one of their dreams is to be able to improve their businesses and family stability so they can be united and have a better future.

Carlos Manuel is asking for a loan in order to have working capital and generate a better income so he can help his family get on in life. He is grateful for the support and the opportunity which the Kiva lenders give to people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can make a decent and honest living.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as bicycle spares and cosmetics among other items.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam, 46, is married and has two children, one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She earns an income running a business of selling food for breakfast in front of her house. 

She started this business 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food to make different meals to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Aghavni

texts.en: Aghavni is an experienced farmer from the village of Azatan in Shirak region. She lives with her husband and son. She is self-employed in her agribusiness. Aghavni, with the help of her family, cultivates potatoes as the only source of her family’s income. Aghavni's husband and son help her by selling the potatoes in the local market. To continue the cultivation of the potatoes, the family needs to invest some financial resources. They particularly need a loan of USD $2000 to purchase some fertilizer for the potatoes, to pay for the irrigation and the water bills, as well as to pay for the harvesting and transportation of the farm products. Aghavni and her hard-working family will be grateful to the lenders for helping them to collect loan amount, which will greatly impact their agribusiness and their lives in general.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the potatoes, to pay for the irrigation and the water bills and to pay for the harvesting and transportation of the farm products

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My is 50 years old and married. Her husband is a driver for hire. 

For four years, My has supported her family by working as a tailor. She started this business to cover her expenses and to raise her child. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

My is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of sewing materials to enable her to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Massah is 28 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has two children, ages 1 and 8. They both live with her and the older child attends school. She stopped her education at grade 8.
For five years, Massah has been selling soap, tissue, toothpaste, etc. She sells from morning to evening every day. She likes how she makes her own money. 
Massah has requested a loan to purchase more soap, tissue, toothpaste, etc. In the future, she wants to be her own boss and wants her children to live a good life. She thanks BRAC Liberia for its continuous support.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, tissue, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 48 years old. He is married with six children, ages 7 to 20. With the loan, he would like to buy more to buy fertilizer and quality seed for potato production. With the profits from the produce, he will buy more foodstuffs for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seed for his potato farm.

loans.name: Safwan

texts.en: Safwan, a 24-year-old single man, lives in Ibb, Yemen where he earns a low salary as a company's employee. Sometime he faces difficulties in communicating with people and so is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB to buy a mobile phone. He looks forward to starting up his own enterprise.

loans.use: to buy a mobile phone

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 33 years old. He has been a farmer for the past ten years. He is married, with two children. With the loan, he wants to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to settle the basic needs of the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for potato production.

loans.name: Sangita

texts.en:
Sangita is 44 years old. She is married and has three children, ages 26, 23, and 20. Many years ago, she established her vegetable-farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her business. In the future, Sangita plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano tiene 63 años, para poder salir adelante trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola, en el cual labora alrededor de 8 horas al día, con el fruto de su trabajo solventa los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo; el cree que está saliendo adelante porque se esfuerza mucho y es responsable en su trabajo.

Luciano está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado  podrá comprar materiales para poder mejorar su vivienda, la cual se encuentran en malas condiciones actualmente, así el podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Luciano is 63 years old.  In order to move forward, he works as a laborer on an agricultural estate.  He works approximately eight hours a day.  With the fruit of his labor, Luciano is able to cover his household expenses with a great amount of effort.  He believes that he has been able to get ahead because he tries very hard and is responsible in his work.  

Luciano is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to buy materials for improving his home, which is in bad condition.  He will now be able to improve his quality of life.  Luciano continues to strive toward fulfilling his dream of finishing the construction of his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: La señora Alicia de 43 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Liriuni, estado civil viuda, tiene 2 hijos menores que estudian en nivel primaria, la actividad económica de la señora Alicia es la agricultura, produce papa, papaliza, oca, cultivan en 2 hectáreas de terreno con rotación de cultivos,  los terrenos son herencia de sus padres, la sra. Alicia solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como ser abono orgánico, semilla de papa. El dinero que tenia ahorrado lo invirtió en la compra de ganado vacuno lechero,  la sra. Alicia indica que con la compra de los insumos para la siembra de esta campaña agrícola, estaría garantizando la seguridad alimentaria de su familia y lograra tener ahorro para el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en: Alicia, 43, lives in the community of Liriuni. She is a widow and has two young children who are in elementary school. Her business is agriculture. She grows potatoes, ulluco, and oca. She grows on two hectares of land using crop rotation. The land was inherited from her parents. Alicia is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies like organic fertilizer and potato seed. She invested the money she had saved in dairy cattle. Alicia says that with the purchase of the supplies for this planting season, she will guarantee her family's food security and have savings for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to waterproof the roof.

loans.name: Big Vision Group

texts.en:
Big Vision is an eight-member group, registered with VEP and hailing from Kiambu County in Central Kenya. It is composed of members who run small businesses as well as practice farming.
Teresa, the group chair (far left in the photo) is a small-scale farmer who grows maize, sorghum and millet. She runs a hardware store whose income contributes to the family needs such as food, school fees and taking care of their very poor neighbors. She joined Big Vision group early last year to empower her day-to-day life and business through affordable credit and to access solar lamps and cook stoves which proves efficient in her area since they save on fuel costs. Teresa had previously accessed her first loan with the group which she used to start up the business and has successfully repaid the loan.
This year, she sold her farm produce at good prices and used the money to meet the family’s basic needs. Income from her hardware business paid school fees for her two children in high school. After repaying the first loan, she came up with the idea of stocking the business with solar lamps and energy-saving cook stoves. She shared the idea with her fellow members who are also business people and they were ready to adapt the idea as well,  having seen the opportunity that is presented by the scarcity of fuel for cooking and lighting in their region.This will lead to more income for them and their families. They opted for a loan from VEP to stock their businesses. Profits will be used to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy solar lamps and energy saving stoves for resale

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a hard-working agronomist from the village of Lukashin in the Armavir region. Her family consists of her husband and two sons (the youngest of them is a school-age boy).  Anahit’s older son works in the private sector; however, the salary he gets there is not enough to meet the family’s daily needs. 

The family's most important source of income is its agricultural business. Anahit is particularly engaged in breeding sheep, wheat cultivation, alfalfa cultivation, and cultivation of cabbage and watermelons. Her family members support her a lot in selling the agro products at the local market. 

As the family’s daily expenses grow with time, they now need to enlarge their agribusiness a little bit.  A loan of US$ 3,000 will be a huge support to them.  It will enable them to purchase five steers and to pay for the harvesting of the wheat, as well as to purchase wheat seeds. 

They will be grateful to all the lenders for helping them to gather the needed amount of loan for maintaining and enlarging their agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy five steers, pay for harvesting her wheat, and buy wheat seeds

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
From Liberia, Julie is 42 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She and her husband share a home with their five children, who range in age from 2 to 21, one of whom has graduated from high school.


Presently Julie is attending a university while she is managing her clothing sales enterprise to make ends meet. She sells three days a week, 10 hours per day.  In operation for three years, she explains that sometimes business is slow, but most of the time she realizes a profit which she uses to sustain her family.


Julie is requesting a loan to purchase more Lappa (fabric) for her business. She wishes in the near future to build a decent house. She appreciates the support of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (fabric) for her business.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora es una mujer muy ocupada ya que además de dedicarse al campo también se encarga de realizar las labores del hogar, afortunadamente para ella sus tres hijas le ayudan para así poder salir adelante. Su esposo Fermín es quien se encarga del trabajo más pesado en la finca de café aunque ella y sus hijas también lo ayudan. El café que producen es orgánico y el fertilizante que utilizan en sus fincas ellos mismos lo producen. Aurora y su familia necesitan comprar fertilizante ya que hace poco resembraron parte de su finca por eso solicitan un crédito. También nos platicó que tienen pensado comprar un terreno de media hectárea y que ya están haciendo los trámites correspondientes. Aunque el café es su principal fuente de ingresos también se dedican a producir plátano, chile y chayote pues algunos de los terrenos con que cuentan son ideales para estas actividades. A Aurora y su esposo les gustaría más adelante poner un negocio de abarrotes en su casa para que lo atiendan sus hijas.
texts.en: Aurora is a very busy woman, since in addition to working in the fields, she also takes care of housework. Fortunately for her, her three daughters help her so that she can move forward. Her husband Fermín is the person who takes care of the heavier work in the coffee field, even though she and her daughters also help. The coffee they grow is organic and they make the fertilizer that they use in the fields. Aurora and her family need to buy fertilizer since a little awhile ago, they replanted part of their farm, so they are asking for this loan. She also told that us that they are considering buying a half hectare of land and that they are already going through the corresponding process. Although coffee is their main source of income, they also work growing bananas, peppers, and pear squash, since of the the land they have is ideal for this work. In the future, Aurora and her husband would like to set up a small grocery store in their house for their daughters to manage.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Hari Maya

texts.en:
Hari Maya is 40 years old .  She is married and has 2 children, aged 20 and 16.  Many years ago, she established  her poultry farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  

Hari Maya has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chickens for her business.  In the future, Hari Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: buy chicks for her poultry farm

loans.name: Blanca Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Blanca de 61 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, ella se dedica al agricultura especialmente al cultivo de guayaba desde hace varios años,  es una persona humilde, educada, trabajadora con muy buena moral, posee una gran clientela establecida, gracias a la calidad de sus cultivos, a diario los comercializa en una zona muy transitada que siempre busca de sus productos, de esta manera ha logrado solventar  muchos de sus gastos, Doña blanca solicita préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos, mano de obra, y compra de bolsas para cubrir sus cultivos, de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y darle a su familia un mejor futuro económico.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca and lives in her own home with her children.  She has been farming for many years and specializes in growing guavas.  Blanca is a humble, educated, and hardworking person who has very good morals.  She has a large established clientele thanks to the quality of her crops.  Every day she sells in a very busy area where people are always looking for her products.  This has allowed her to cover many of her expenses.  

Doña Blanca is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her crops, pay for labor, and acquire bags for packaging the fruit.  As a result, she will be able to improve her income and provide her family a better financial future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her guava crop, pay for labor, and acquire bags for packaging the fruit.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 72 years old, married and supports a family of five members. His wife is a farmer while he runs a retail shop. Simon has been in the business for the last 20 years and gets a monthly income of KES 30000. 

With this third loan of KES 40000 from KADET Simon plans to restock his shop with a variety of consumable products. The anticipated profits will be ploughed back to business for expansion. His dream is to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: add stocks to his shop

loans.name: Dao

texts.en:
Dao is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker for a construction company. For five years, she has run a beauty salon in her community.

Dao would like a loan to purchase better quality hair care tools to better serve her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through this loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: buy hair care tools

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 31 years old. He is a father of two children, aged two and six. He has been farming for the past ten years. With this loan, he would like buy more to buy fertilizers and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to pay for more family basic needs that have been of his dream.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es: El Sr. Rubén tiene 47 años, casado tiene  tres hijos ya mayores de edad que se encuentran terminando sus estudios, El Sr. Rubén se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Rubén va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Rubén va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, El Sr. Rubén es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia y pagar el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rubén, 47, is married and has three adult children who are completing their schooling.  Rubén works selling a variety of basic staple items like groceries and a variety of general goods items in his neighborhood store.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution 

Rubén will use this loan to buy a variety of grocery items like rice, noodles, flour and sugar at wholesale to stock his store thus providing variety for his customers.  His reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving his business.

Rubén will use profits to continue buying products thus improving his income.  Rubén is a very hardworking person who feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided since this is the only activity that makes it possible for him to support his family and pay for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is 31 years old and is married. She has a daughter and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband has been running a business  selling gas tanks at their house for three years.  

Nhung intends to use her loan to buy many kinds appliances and gas tanks from different suppliers to better meet demands of her customers.  She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy gas tanks and appliances to sell at her store.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick lives in the Likoni area south of Mombasa, Kenya. He is 26 years old.  Fredrick runs an insurance business that has been there for the last two years. The business has really grown and he wants to open an office so that he can serve his customers well. This is his sole business that gives him income. 

Fredrick has a child who is two years old.  In the next five years he hopes that the business would grow so that he can move into other towns as well. He knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy office furniture. The challenge in his venture is competition from establishes firms.  The extra income he will raise will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy office furniture

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha live in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market in Montserrado county.  She is 49 years old, married and has 8 children between 19 and 27 years old, only two are in school and live at home.  Her husband work for Firestone. 

Martha was able to complete high school before starting a business.  For the past three years she has been frying and selling rice in her community market.  She got money from her oldest sister to start this business.   She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by bag for her business.  She wishes to buy a land and build her house.

loans.use: buy rice to sell

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan, 41, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a driver for hire. Lan earns an income processing cotton and making cotton products, which she started to do one year ago.

Lan is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of raw cotton materials to increase her production and sales.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cotton materials

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina, age 65 is from the Gori district where she lives with her orphaned 11-year-old grandson. Tina gets retirement pension from the local government and  unstable, small money transfers from the abroad where her daughter lives and works. 

Tina used to sell clothing and household items but her business was stopped due to the domestic reasons. She has enough experience and a great desire to restart her trading activities. That is why Tina has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing and household items at wholesale prices in Sarpi open market (near Turkish border) where prices are lower than in other parts of Georgia and start a trading business. Tina will be able to get profit and cover feeding and education expenses for her grandson. She awaits your generosity

loans.use: buy clothing and household items to sell

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is 52 years old and is married with two children, one son and one daughter. Her husband is a security guard in his community. Lan has been running a general store in front of her door for three years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Lan is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more household items and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more household items and many kinds of soft drinks.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia es hija de una familia muy humilde, su padre vino del sur del país en busca de mayores oportunidades,  ella ya nació en el trópico de Cochabamba, a su padre le costó mantenerla porque tenía varios hijos, ella desde muy chica trabajo, ayudando en la parcela de su padre,  compro con gran sacrificio una vivienda de madera, trabajo de todo, no tuvo la oportunidad para seguir estudiando porque su padre no le podía costear sus estudios, entonces trabajaba y estudiaba hasta concluir el nivel secundario y poco a poco se independizo, actualmente tiene un puesto de venta de frutas, adicionalmente se está dedicando a la agricultura en el terreno de su padre está colocando yuca, Dionicia es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora su sueño es seguir creciendo además de construir una mejor  vivienda de la que tiene actualmente ya que hoy en día solo vive en una casita de madera, por esta razón está solicitando el préstamo que será muy importante poder contar con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dionicia comes from a very humble family.  Her father moved from the south of the country seeking better opportunities.  She was born in the Cochabamba tropics.  

It was very difficult for her father to support her because he had several children.  She started working while very young helping her father work his parcel.  With much sacrifice she bought a wood house.  She worked doing all kinds of things and did not have the opportunity to continue in school because her father couldn’t afford to pay for her schooling.  So she worked and studied until she was able to finish secondary school and gradually she became independent.  She currently has a fruit stand and also works in agriculture growing manioc on her father’s land.

Dionicia’s a responsible, very hardworking woman whose dream is to continue growing and to build a house that’s better than the one she has now for she currently just lives in a small wood house.  This is why she’s requesting the loan for it’s very important to be able to have better quality of life.

loans.use: to make some home upgrades.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a single lady, age 31, and a mother of one child, age seven years old. Her main business is selling secondhand clothes. She has been in operation for three years, earning an income of KES 15,000.

She has borrowed a third loan of KES 40,000 from KADET Ltd. and intends to use this amount to pay her college fees. The profits that she earns from the clothing business will be used repay the loan as well as furnish her house.

Her dream is to prosper in business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay her college fees.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 35 years old.   He has been a farmer for the past 15 years.  He is married to a farmer, and they have one child. 

Vincent has requested a loan for buying fertilizer and quality seeds for his production of potatoes. The profits from his business will be used to reinvest in his potato farm.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and quality seeds for his potato farm

loans.name: Amazonas Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMAZONAS  II”  iniciará el décimo octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ssucy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de repuestos, sastrería, pensión, trenzado de chalinas, carnicería, venta de ropa de bebe, taller de edredones, venta de ropa americana.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ssucy es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne; este negocio lo emprendió hace treinta años atrás aprendiendo al observar la necesidad de un frial en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de moledora) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y el compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Amazonas II” communal bank will start its 18th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Ssucy.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: spare parts sales, tailor shop, catering, scarf knitting, butcher shop, infant wear sales, bedspread manufacturing and American clothes sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Ssucy.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for ten years having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently works selling meat, a business she learned 30 years ago when she noticed that her area needed a butcher.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy a meat grinder from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then install in in her sales space.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income needed to support her home as best as possible for she’s in a common law relationship and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the health area and spending time with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy a meat grinder.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 54 years old and is married. Her husband is a bricklayer. She has been running a grocery store for four years. She started this business to cover her expenses. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hoa is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more kinds of vegetables so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Hilton Moisés

texts.es:
Hilton es un hombre de 26 años, solo estudio 2° grado, depende de él tres hermanos menores y su madre, los hermanos tienen edades de 3, 5 y 9 años, y solo estudia en la escuela una de ellas.

Él se dedica a la agricultura y a la albañilería desde hace 15 años, aprendió el oficio trabajando con sus tíos, y en la actualidad siempre se dedica a las mismas actividades, para los cultivos agrícolas solo camina a pie por unas veredas, unos 15 minutos y para los trabajos de albañilería, viaja grandes distancias, aproximadamente 2 horas en bus y tiene que quedarse en el lugar de trabajo hasta por una semana.


El crédito lo utilizara para comprar 7 quintales de abono, y 3 litros de herbicidas. Al aplicar los fertilizantes en el momento oportuno y la cantidad adecuada las plantas producirán más y mejor, permitiendo que se tenga una muy buena cosecha y mejores ganancias para darles un mejor sustento a su familia; con el crédito podrá comprar los productos que necesita y le hará una mejor aplicación de los mismos a sus cultivos y obtendrá una mejor cosecha para alimentar a su familia.
