Uno de sus principales sueños es construir su casa para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Hilton is a 26-year-old man who only has a second grade education.  His three younger siblings (ages 3, 5, and 9) and his mother are dependent on him.  Only one of the siblings is attending school.  

Hilton has been farming and working as a bricklayer since he was 15 years old.  He learned these trades from his uncles.  At the moment, he spends all of his time in these trades.  In order to reach the plot where he grows his crops, he must walk along a few paths for approximately 15 minutes.  For his masonry jobs, he must travel great distances, approximately two hours by bus.  He usually has to stay a week at the place where the work is located.  

Hilton will use this loan to buy seven quintals (1 quintal = 46 kg) of compost and three liters of herbicides.  He will apply the fertilizers at the opportune moment and in the right quantity so that his crops will produce more and be of better quality.  This will result in a very good harvest and more income by which he will be able to better provide for his family.  

With this loan, Hilton will be able to buy the products that he needs and apply them to his crops in the best way.  This will result in a better harvest so that he can feed his family.  One of his main goals is to build a house for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides.

loans.name: Raul Edgardo

texts.es: Raúl, tiene 40 años de edad, está casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Puerto Cortes.  Anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila y al quedar sin empleo el decidió tener su propio negocio para generar sus ingresos. Lleva 3 años de comprar y vender huevos de gallina, frijoles y licuados. El se moviliza en un vehículo y distribuye a las pulperías.  El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 15,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de huevos para vender y aumentar los ingresos. Su plan es poder darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Raúl, 40, is married with two children and lives in a village in Puerto Cortes municipality.  He used to work in an assembly plant but when he became unemployed he decided to have a business of his own to generate income.  He’s been buying and selling chicken eggs, beans and blended drinks for three years.  He gets around in a vehicle and distributes to grocery stores.  The loan he’s requested is for 15,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy eggs to sell and increase his income.  His plan is to be able to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy eggs to sell.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram, an experienced agronomist, is from the village Lehvaz of Syunik region. He lives with his big family – wife and four children (two daughters and two sons) who support Aram a lot in his everyday struggle to earn a living for his family. 

Aram is currently involved in breeding a livestock of pigs and piglets, as well as cultivating fruits (peach, pomegranate, blood orange, quince, apple, pear and nuts). 

Livestock breeding and horticulture are the most important sources of income of the family. Aram sells the Agro products not only in the local market, but he also transports the products to the capital city, where all those fruits have higher demand. 

Aram is now eager to enlarge his livestock of pigs to become more compatible and effectively meet the family’s needs. A loan of USD 3,000 will help him a lot to purchase three pigs and some forage for the livestock. Aram and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and are thankful to them for the support.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DIOS ES AMOR”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sinforoza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de abarrotes, artesano en chompas, limpieza, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sinforoza es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de chompas; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás aprendiendo la técnica en una institución de formación, posteriormente decide emprender su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de  Perú y posteriormente a la elaboración lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “DIOS ES AMOR” ["God is Love"] Communal Bank is about to start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch centre. The group has eight members and is governed by a board of directors of whom Sinforoza is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include: food sales, sweater sales, grocery sales, artesenal sweaters, cleaning, and fruit sales.
This loan will benefit these small businesses. Sinforoza says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for eight years. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is also a member. She currently has a business making and selling sweaters. She started this business several years ago and learned the technique from a technical school. She then decided to start her own workshop.
This loan is for an increase in working capital (the purchase of wool). She will buy wool from Peru and later set it up in her sales space. This work allows her to generate an income to maintain her household where possible. She is married and has one daughter.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Dúo Cariño Group

texts.es: Dúo cariño este grupo esta conformado por la señora Elsa Magdalena de 46 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y para adultos, esta muy contenta porque su negocio dia con dia ba en aumento, y tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes y con el capital que tiene no alcanza cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa para niños y para adultos, esperando que ustedes le sigan ayudando para que ella pueda seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
There are two members in the Dúo Cariño group. One of them is 46-year old Sra. Elsa Magdalena who earns her living selling children's and adults' clothing. She is very pleased because her business is gradually growing and she has many orders from her customers. 

With the capital she has, Elsa cannot meet all her customers' orders so she is seeking a loan to buy more clothing. She hopes that you will help so that she can continue making progress with her business.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Modesto Victor

texts.es: Desde que Modesto Victor era pequeño su padre le enseñó a trabajar en el campo, actividad que alternaba con sus estudios. Con el paso del tiempo fue aprendiendo todo lo necesario para convertirse en productor de café. Modesto Victor está casado con Soledad y tienen cuatro hijos los cuales le ayudan a trabajar en las parcelas durante la época de vacaciones. Él es uno de los productores que más café entregan a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” pues durante la última cosecha tuvo una producción de diez y seis toneladas. Parte de esa producción de café es orgánico y la otra parte es convencional sin embargo Modesto Victor está trabajando para convertir en su totalidad su producción a café orgánico. Para la siguiente cosecha Victor necesita comprar fertilizantes y para eso solicita un crédito. A Modesto Victor le gustaría poner dentro de unos meses un negocio de abarrotes en su casa y además de eso también maneja un taxi para así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Modesto Víctor’s father taught him how to work the land when he was still little; he’d do this work alternating it with his studies.  As time passed, he learned everything necessary to become a coffee grower.  

Modesto Víctor is married to Soledad and they have four children who help him work the land during their vacation period.  He’s one of the growers that produces the most coffee delivered to “Unión Regional de Huatusco” [coffee cooperative].  In his previous harvest he yielded 16 tons.  Part of his production is organic and part is conventional.  However, Modesto Víctor is working to convert it to totally organic.

Víctor needs to buy fertilizer for the upcoming harvest and this is why he’s requesting the loan.  In a few months he’d like to open a home-based grocery store and he also drives a taxi to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Desde hace más de 50 años Luisa se ha dedicado a la producción de café, primero comenzó al lado de su padre ayudándolo en algunas labores en la finca y en la época de corte. Cuando ella se casó siguió realizado esta actividad con su esposo quien también es productor de café. El café que Luisa produce es orgánico, pues no utiliza fertilizantes químicos. Ella entrega toda su producción cada año a la "Unión Regional", que se encarga de procesarlo y exportarlo. Para esta cosecha Luisa solicita un crédito para comprar fertilizante y pagar a cortadores de café. Este crédito lo pagará al final de la cosecha con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en: For over 50 years Luisa has produced coffee. She started off with her father, helping him with the farm work and in the harvest season. After she was married, she continued to do this work with her husband, who is also a coffee producer. Luisa's farm is organic; she does not use chemical fertilizers. She delivers all of her crop every year to the Regional Union, which is in charge of processing and exporting it. For this harvest, Luisa is requesting a loan for he purchase of fertilizer and to pay coffee cutters. She will pay off this loan at the end of the harvest with her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay coffee cutters.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep, 62, is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running an internet shop in front of their house. 

She started this business seven years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of CPUs and game cards to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of CPUs and game cards for her internet shop.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: La Sra. Pilar tiene 39 años,  casada con cuatro  hijos de las edades de 8, 9, 12 y 15,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la localidad de El Torno,  es cliente nueva de la institución ya que es su primera secuencia, la Sra. Pilar va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca y levadura por mayor para la elaboración de pan, la Sra. Pilar es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en: Pilar, 39, is married with four children whose ages are 8, 9, 12 and 15.  She works baking and selling bread.  Her bakery is located in El Torno.  She’s a new institution client and this is her first sequence.  Pilar will use this loan to buy bread-baking ingredients like flour, shortening and yeast at wholesale.  Pilar is a person who very much wants to improve and she feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided because this is the only activity that makes it possible for her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, shortening and yeast at wholesale.

loans.name: Eynas

texts.en:
Eynas is 27 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen.  She studied laboratory science. Recently she has a small clinic that she uses to develop her experience and earn an income.

In Yemen there is a big need for her type of business. She is a good-matured woman who says, "I would like to develop this medical clinic by purchasing products in large quantities for economic reasons.” 

She would like to stock her clinic to offer different services for her patients. So she is requesting a loan of YER 150,000  to buy electronic medical instruments to use in her clinic. She hopes to grow her medical activity in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy electronic medical instruments to use in her clinic.

loans.name: Alba Maricela

texts.es: Alba, tiene 27 años de edad,  esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos y su esposo en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Ella ha decidido por su propio negocio, hace dos años y medio que estableció su negocio en un local de un mercado local donde vende productos de abarrotería como jabón, huevos, manteca, azúcar, harina, granos básicos, productos enlatados, papel higiénico, especies etc. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 10,000 lempiras y los va invertir en surtir su negocio de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, manteca, huevos y otros para incrementar las ventas. Su plan es trabajar  en su negocio para darles mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Alba is 27. She is married with children and lives with them in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. She started her own business two and a half years ago. She established it in a stall in the local market and sells grocery items such as ham, eggs, butter, sugar, flour, basic staples, canned goods, toilet paper, spices, etc. This loan is for 10,000 lempiras. She will invest it in stocking her business with food products such as basic staples, butter, and eggs in order to increase her sales. Her plan is to work in her business in order to give her children a better life.

loans.use: to buy products such as basic staples, butter, and eggs.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Él se dedica a la venta de productos básicos.
Don Roberto su negocio es una Pulpería desde hace más de 20  años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en la aldea donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, café, pan, aguas, refrescos, salsas, pastas, etc. y así seguir realizando su negocio, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Don Roberto con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por ellos a diario y espera poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y  la de su familia.
Don Roberto espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia para  que tengan  mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
Roberto’s a very hardworking, humble, responsible man living with his family in a community in southern Honduras.  He works selling basic staple goods.

Roberto’s business for more than 20 years has been a grocery store that operates from his home in the village where he lives  He needs the loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, shortening, coffee, bread, water, soft-drinks, sauces, pasta, etc. to stay in business which is his main source of income.

Roberto hopes the loan will lead to higher sales and will be very useful to him because he lacks the goods his customers are requesting and he’ll be able to fill their daily orders.  He hopes to improve his and his family’s quality of life a little.

In the short term, Roberto hopes to make his business grow and with it to be able to continue supporting his family so that they will have better life opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras – August, 2013

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Rosas Lindas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS LINDAS”  iniciará el vigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de tejido a macramé, producción de cacao, elaboración de muebles, panadería, carpintería, costura de deportivos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; este negocio lo emprendió hace cinco años atrás al observar que era el único negocio donde podía estar en casa cuidando a sus hijas y al mismo tiempo generando recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar) que adquirirá de  las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijas.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito ágil.
texts.en:
The Rosas Lindas Community Bank is beginning its twenty-third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch group. There are eight members in the bank led by a Board of Directors. Sra. Lidia is President. The members have a variety of businesses: blanket sales, macrame craft sales, cocoa farming, furniture making, bakery, carpentry, and sewing sportswear. 

The loan they are seeking will benefit small businesswomen such as Sra. Lidia. She joined Pro Mujer two years ago at the invitation of her sister-in-law who is a member of the institution. She currently runs a corner store. She started it five years ago as it was the only business where she could stay at home to care for her daughters and earn money at the same time.

The loan money will be used to buy merchandise such as rice, oil, and sugar from the stores in the town of El Alto and then sell in her own store. This work enables her to earn money for her family as she is married and has three daughters.

When Lidia is asked what she most likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the flexible loan system.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, and sugar

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en:
Juvenal is 41 years old. He is a father of five children. He has been a farmer for the past twenty years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to reinvest in the farming business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds to use in the production of potatoes.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Here is 49-year-old Mamie from Liberia, who has been operating a cook shop over the past six years selling rice and soup around the local market. She is asking for a 20,000 LRD loan to buy more rice, fish, oil charcoal, pepper etc. for her business. To be precise, Mamie lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She completed 12th grade before starting this business. Mamie is married to a teacher and has six children between 19 to 29 years old, only one of whom is currently attending school and five of whom live at home. Mamie complains about the transportation costs as her main challenge. She enjoys the flow of her customers and the profit she makes. She sells for eight hours each day. She hopes to build a house in the near future. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more rice, fish, oil charcoal, pepper etc. for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 38-year-old widow, blessed with five children, aged between 22 and 11 years. 

She is into the green tea leaves selling business in Meswo. She has been in this business for the last three years, generating a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Veronica has borrowed a loan of KES 60,000, which she will use to purchase more green tea leaves for resale. 

She will use part of the anticipated profit to pay her loan and the remaining portion to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with her two daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For 20 years, she has sold lottery tickets in front of her house to earn an income to support her family.

Thu would like a loan to purchase lottery tickets in bulk to increase her sales margin. She hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase lottery tickets to sell

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 49 years old and married, with eight children. He has been in business as a potato farmer for the past ten years. 

With the loan, he plans to buy fertilizer and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes.  The profits anticipated in the produce will be used to provide a better standard of living for his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and seeds for growing potatoes

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long is 58 years old and married. He has four children and lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife runs a cafe.

He has run a business of repairing old electric equipment at his house for 30 years. He intends to use his loan to buy old electric equipment to repair and sell for his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy old electric equipment to repair and sell .

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga, 61, is widowed and has a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Nga started a general store 15 years ago. She sells household items, food and beverages. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products such as detergent, shampoo, and sanitation items to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products such as detergent, shampoo, and sanitation items.

loans.name: Sinita

texts.en:
Sinita is 30 years old. She is married and has one 5-year-old child. 

Many years ago, Sinita established a cow's milk selling business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW.  Sinita will use this loan to buy a young dairy cow. 

In the future Sinita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young dairy cow

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 43 years old. She is a mother of five children. She has been in farming for the past fifteen years. With this loan she would like to buy fertilizer and quality seeds for potato production. The profits from the produce will be used to help the well being of her family members.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product; generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue; and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and quality seeds for potato production

loans.name: Ignace

texts.en:
Ignace is 31 years old. He is a farmer and has been running this sector for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and quality seeds for use during the production of potatoes. The profits from the produce will be used to reinvest in potato farming for better results in the future.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and quality seeds

loans.name: Subdra

texts.en: Subdra is 34 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 17, 12 and 11.  In 2010, she established  her goat-raising business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy baby goats for her business.  In the future, Subdra plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy baby goats for her business

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: El señor Sabino es una persona trabajadora, tiene 47 años de edad, procedente de la zona de Quillacollo vivió gran parte de su juventud trabajando y estudiando hasta lograr obtener un nivel de técnico medio, se caso a corta edad, tiene 5 dependientes que actualmente estudian en diferentes niveles, para mejorar sus ingresos se traslado al trópico de Cochabamba con toda la familia lugar en el cual fue bien recibido por sus conocimientos y arduo trabajo en su parcela agrícola, anteriormente trabajaba con varias instituciones, por esta razón descuido su hogar y su parcela agrícola; actualmente ya no trabaja con otras instituciones se dedico por completo a la atención de su parcela, por esta razón  solícita un préstamo para la compra de plantines de papaya que le permitan mejorar los cultivos en su parcela mejorando su producción y así seguir apoyando a su familia de cerca.
texts.en:
Sabino, 47, is a hardworking person from the Quillacollo area.  He spent a big part of his youth working and studying until he became a mid-level technician.  He married when he was young and has five dependents who are currently at different stages of their education.  To improve his income he moved with the whole family to the tropics of Cochabamba, where he was well received because of his knowledge and hard work on his farmland.

Previously Sabino worked with a variety of institutions and didn't take care of his home and land.  He no longer works with other institutions; he devotes himself completely to taking care of his land.

This is why Sabino's requesting a loan to buy papaya plantings.  He's going to improve the plants on his land and his crop so he can continue to help his family close up.

loans.use: to buy papaya plantings

loans.name: Lissy Escarlen

texts.es: La señora Lissy de 20 años de edad, vive con su conyugue hace 1 año, la señora Lissy se dedica a la producción de leche cruda y la elaboración de quesillos, tiene una experiencia de 4 años, para dicha actividad cuenta con 6 cabezas de ganado vacuno lechero, de las cuales 3 se encuentran en producción y 3 se encuentran preñadas o en etapa de secado, para la alimentación y extracción de leche cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja, ambos muestran responsabilidad y muchas ganas de superarse, además su conyugue se dedica a prestar servicios como mecánico, trabajando los 6 días de la semana, el motivo del presente crédito es porque la señora Lissy  tubo gastos inesperados, presento algunas complicaciones con su embarazo, motivo por el cual solicito la ayuda económica para la compra de insumos para su ganado (cascara de soya y forraje), debido a que en esta época del año escasea el alimento y es muy poca la producción de forraje.
texts.en:
Lissy, 20, has lived with her spouse for a year.  She works as a raw milk producer and cheese maker.  She has four years’ experience.  To do said activity she owns six cows three of which are producing and three of which are either pregnant or in the nonlactating period.  Her husband helps her with the milking and feeding chores.  They are both very responsible and with strong drives for self-improvement.  Also, her spouse works as a mechanic six days a week.

The reason for the current loan is that Lissy had some unexpected expenses and some complications with her pregnancy so she’s had to seek economic help to buy supplies for her cattle (soy husks and forage) because feed becomes scarce during this season and forage production is very small.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Se dedica a la costura desde hace 3 años.
Doña María tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en la aldea donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de telas, agujas, hilos, etc. y así seguir realizando sus trabajos los cuales le brindan una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña María con la inversión que realice a su negocio espera que sus ingresos aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por ellos a diario.
 Doña María desea poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. Espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para  tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
Sra. María is a hardworking, simple, and responsible person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her family. She has earned her living sewing for three years.

María runs her business from her home in the neighbourhood where she lives. She needs the loan to buy fabric, needles, thread etc. so that she can continue the work that provides the majority of the household income. She hopes that as a result her income will increase as she currently lacks some of the products that her customers are asking for on a daily basis.

María wishes to use her increased earnings to improve her own and her family's standard of living. In the short term she wants to grow her business so she can continue supporting her family. She hopes that her children will have the education they need to have greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: buy fabric, needles, thread etc. for her business

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Nirmala is 43 years old .  She is married and has 2 children aged 24 and 21.  Many years ago she established a vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.  

In the future, Nirmala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dipika

texts.en:
Dipika is 26 years-old; she is married and has no children.  

In 2010, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid a loan from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. 

In the future, Dipika plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
This is thirty-eight-year-old Satta, who lives in the town of West Point. She is unmarried and has three children, ages between 9 and 16. Her children are attending school and living at home. Satta is a third grade dropout, who is now selling flour, sugar, and rice by the cupful, to make her life and her children's lives better. She considers herself a hard-working businesswoman. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending ten hours each day on her business.

Satta has requested a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, and rice by the bag, to increase her daily sales. She hopes to be an international businesswoman, and she hopes to have her own house. She thanks BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, and rice by the bag, to increase her daily sales.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 41-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children, ages 10 and 8. 

She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store business for a year now. She sells various items like eggs, biscuits, detergent, cooking oil, soft drinks, shampoo, and vinegar. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, sugar, vinegar, and soy sauce. Currently, she always runs out of stock for these items. The loan will be such a big help for her to increase her inventory and earn better.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business, and successfully send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, vinegar, and soy sauce

loans.name: Conrada

texts.es: Conrada se ha dedicado a la produccón de café desde hace más de 20 años. Sus hijos son quien la ayudan en todas las actividades que hay que realizar en las parcelas y ella se encarga de administrar el negocio. Ella entrega toda su producción a la "Unión Regional", asociasión que se encarga de procesar y exportar el café. Para esta cosecha ella necesita un crédito para pagar a cortadores de café, pues es mucho trabajo el que hay que hacer y sus hijos no pueden encargarse de todo. Ella pagará este crédito al final de la cosecha con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en:
Conrada has worked as a coffee grower for more than 20 years.  Her children help her with all the chores that need to be done on the parcels and she takes care of managing the business.  She delivers her entire crop yield to the “Unión Regional” [coffee cooperative], an association that takes care of processing and exporting the coffee.

She needs a loan for the upcoming harvest to pay coffee pickers because there is much work to be done and her children can’t do it all.  She will repay the loan at the end of harvest with profits earned from it.

loans.use: to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROCA FUERTE”  iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Patricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, ladrillera, venta de detergente, salón de belleza, venta de cosméticos, venta de carne, venta de ropa interior, venta de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Patricia es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la Institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de detergentes; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió conjuntamente su madre hace veinte años atrás, posteriormente a casarse decide independizar su negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de detergentes) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que se tiene en la institución.
texts.en:
The ”Roca Fuerte” (Mighty Rock) communal bank will start its 9th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Patricia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: food sales, brick making, detergent sales, beauty salon, cosmetics sales, meat sales, underwear sales and grocery sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Patricia.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for seven years having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling detergent.  She comments that she started the business with her mother 20 years ago and when she  got married decided to go into business on her own.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy detergent from wholesale suppliers in the city of El Alto and then sell it in her sales space.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate resources to support her home as possible for she’s married with two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the savings she has in the institution.

loans.use: to buy detergent.

loans.name: Grace B.

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Grace from Liberia.  Currently she lives in Gardnersville area, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and has three children between 6 and 17 years old.  Unfortunately she stopped her education in 8th grade.  

For the past two years now she has been operating a table where she sells palm oil in the local market. She spends ten hours on her business each day, six days a week.  She likes her business because she has more customers and makes lots of profit. She started this business with money given to her by mother. Mostly she taxis to have her goods at her table.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business.  Her plans are to build her own house and become an international business woman.  

She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Jyoti

texts.en:
Jyoti is a 28-year-old married mother of  two children aged 10 and 4.  In 2013, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  


Jyoti has already received and repaid one loan from Patan BPW and will use this one to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Jyoti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 


In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis tiene 59 años de edad, padre de un hijo y vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes fincas de la región donde reside, pero hace aproximadamente 10 años decidió independizarse y, con un dinero que le prestaron, montó una tienda de abarrotes en la que trabaja todos los días de 8:00 am a 9:00 pm,  es así como obtiene los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar. El cliente es un señor pujante, luchador, amable y perseverante, trabaja con esmero para sacar su negocio adelante, sobrepasando momentos difíciles por diversos motivos, especialmente los problemas de orden público que se presentaban durante varios días, lo que afectaba directamente sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos, sin embargo, esto no lo detuvo en su lucha y poco a poco la situación ha ido mejorando. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito que desea invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor (aceite, productos de aseo, granos, pastas, mecato, galletería, productos enlatados, entre otros) y compra de vitrinas y estantes, con esto podrá mejorar la capacidad del negocio para el almacenamiento y ofrecerá una mayor variedad de productos para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de los clientes, aumentando así las ventas y los ingresos que recibe. De esta forma, Luis tendrá la posibilidad de avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño que es ampliar su negocio y tenerlo bien surtido, que le genere mejores ingresos y pueda disfrutar al lado de su familia una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luis, 59, is the father of one son.  He lives with his common-law companion.

In his work life Luis has made a living on various farms in the area where he lives.  About 10 years ago, however, he decided to go out on his own and set up a grocery store where he works every day from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m.  This is how he earns enough money to support his household.

Luis is a thriving, persevering, and kind man.  He works with care to get his business ahead, overcoming various difficult moments, especially the public type of problems that come up and affect his sales and, consequently, his income.  This didn't get in the way of his perseverance, however, and little by little the situation has improved.

This is what motivates Luis to request the loan he wants to invest in buying stock wholesale (oil, cleaning products, grains, pasta, pastry, cookies, canned goods, and other products).  He also wants to buy display cases and shelves to improve the storage capacity of his business and offer a greater variety of products to satisfy his customers' tastes and needs.

This way Luis will increase his sales and his income, and have the possibility of moving toward his dream of expanding his business and having it well stocked.  This will generate greater income for him, and he and his family will enjoy a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale

loans.name: Dúo La Bendicion Group

texts.es: Dúo la Bendicion este grupo esta conformado por la señora Ana Brenda de 40 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario le da gracias a Dios por la oportunidad de tener su tienda ya que por medio del negocio a podido tener nuevas oportunidades para sus hijos, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en productos de consumo diario para la venta esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar, y le pide a Dios para que ustedes esten bien y sigan ayudando a las personas que lo nececitan.
texts.en:
“La Bendición” (The Blessing) Duo

Ana Brenda, 40, is part of this duo and she works selling basic staple goods.  She thanks God for the opportunity of owning a store because by means of the business she’s been able to have new opportunities for her children. 

She’s asking for this loan to buy more daily consumption staple items to sell hoping you will be able to help her.  She prays God for your well-being and that you will continue to help people in need.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Gion

texts.en: Gion is requesting a new loan to buy a range of food and beverages to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as food and beverages, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Krishna Maya is 34 years old.  She is married and has two children, aged 15 and 11.  Many years ago, she established her cow-raising business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She has used this most recent loan to buy a young, milk-giving cow.  In the future, Krishna Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking.  On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Lucy M.

texts.en:
Lucy M. is 20 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  She is single with a five-year-old child who lives at home and is attending school.  Lucy M. is a high school graduate.

Lucy M. has been selling used clothes for the past two years. She classifies herself as a successful business woman. One thing she enjoys about her business is that it helps her generate more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.

She plans to keep sending her child to a quality school and thanks BRAC for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business

loans.name: Yawah

texts.en:
Yawah is 43 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is a widow and has three children, aged between 20 and 25. She is a high school graduate. Over the past six years she has been running a table business in the local market, where she sells food ingredients like Vita, pepper, salt, onion, oil, and seasonings. She started the business with her own money, which she had saved over the years.

Yawah has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more food ingredients, like Vita, pepper, salt, onion, oil, and seasonings, to attract more customers. In the future, she hopes to have her own house. She is glad to be a BRAC Liberia borrower.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients, including oil, pepper, and onion, to attract more customers.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a young farmer from Muranga County, in central Kenya. He practices zero grazing on his five acres of land. He is also a coffee farmer and a father of three. 

Income from coffee and milk sales is barely enough to take care of all his family needs, such as paying school fees for his children, food, and medication. The costs of fuel and farm inputs are also a burden for the family, which uses firewood and charcoal for cooking and kerosene for lighting.

Sammy opted for a biogas loan from Visionary Empowerment Programme (VEP). With biogas, Sammy would save money on lighting and cooking. Time consumed in firewood collection will be saved and he will get more time to spend with his family.

Sammy's coffee farm will also benefit from the bio-slurry, hence saving him the cost of fertilizer. With a size 12m3 biogas plant, he will easily commercialize it and supply energy to his neighbors, at a cost. Hence, he will be in a better position to repay the loan.

loans.use: to construct a bio-digester on his farm.

loans.name: Jyanti

texts.en:
Jyanti is 38 years old.  She is married and has 2 children aged 20 and 15. 

In 2010 she established a nursery garden business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.  

In the future, Jyanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dil Kumari

texts.en:
Dil Maya is 55 years old.  She is married and has three children, aged 40, 35 and 30.  Many years ago, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used this most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizer.  In the future, Dil Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yolany Sugey

texts.es:
La señora Yolany de 34 años de edad vive con sus padres en barrio de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de pan hornada como ser cemitas de arroz, tortas de pan, hojaldras, quesadillas, rosquete, etc.
Yolany sale a vender de lunes a domingo a todos los barrios del centro de Nacaome, en donde ya tiene sus clientes establecidos y se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya varios años.
Yolany está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de harina, leña, huevos, soda, etc. materia prima para elaborar sus ventas en donde quiere comprar y tener almacenado ya que le sale más ganancia así que está comprando por partes.
Yolany su sueño es aumentar su clientela y mejorar su casa de habitación.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  del 2013.
texts.en:
Yolany, 34, lives with her parents in a neighborhood in San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  She works selling baked goods like rice buns, pound cake, puff pastry, cheese rolls, swirl cake, etc.

Yolany goes out selling from Monday to Sunday in all the neighborhoods in central Nacaome which is where her regular customers are located; she’s been in business for several years.

Yolany’s asking for the loan to buy flour, firewood, eggs, baking soda, etc., all raw materials needed for her sales.  She wants to buy them and and store them because her profits will be higher than buying them in small amounts.  Yolani’s dream is to increase her clientele and to make some home improvements.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September,  2013.

loans.use: to buy flour, firewood, eggs, baking soda, etc.

loans.name: Angel E

texts.en:
21-year-old Angel lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and completed 12th grade. 

Over the past 2 years she has been operating a table which sells soap, toothpaste, rice, etc. in the local market. She spends ten hours on her business each day and likes it because she has more customers and makes lots of profit. She started this business with money given to her by mother. Most of the time she uses the bus to get her goods to her table.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, toothpaste, rice, etc. for her business.

Her plans are to build her own house and become an international business woman.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, toothpaste, rice, etc. for her business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 48 years old and lives in the town of West Point. Her parent was not able to send her to school, but she believes that she is good at taking care of her business and home affairs. She is married and has 6 children ages 12, 15, 18, 20, 25, and 30. Only three of them are attending school. 

For five years now she has been selling charcoal. She learned how to do this business from her mother and the best part of her work is that it keeps her busy. She sells for six days a week, spending 10 hours each day.  She mostly uses taxis to get her goods to her shop. She is glad today that she is independent. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal by bags to increase her sales. In the future she would like to have her own house. She thanks BRAC and its supporters.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal by bags to increase her sales.

loans.name: Miatta

texts.en:
Miatta is 25 years old, single, and has one child.  She lives in Sinkor.. For the past two years, she has been selling rice and soup in a cook shop around the local market. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours a day on her business.  She started this business with money given to her by her child's father. 

Miatta is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, charcoal, etc. for her business.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, charcoal, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in Montserrado County, home to the capital city of Liberia. It is well-known as the commercial city of Liberia. 

Martha is 48 years old and she is married, with three children, aged between 12 and 24 years old. Only two are in school and live at home. 

For the past ten years, Martha has been selling bread, milk, oil, candles, rice, etc. in the community market. She started this business with help from her husband and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends eight hours with her business each day and she uses a taxi, most of the time, to get her goods to her table. 

Martha is requesting a loan to buy more bread, milk, oil, candles, rice, etc. to expand her sales. She wants to get more money and live a good life.

loans.use: to buy more bread, milk, oil, candles, rice, etc. to expand her sales.

loans.name: Zulima Janneth

texts.es: Zulima es una mujer de 44 años de edad y madre de 2 hijas y  cabeza de hogar desde que su esposo falleció hace algún tiempo. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, inicialmente colaborándole a su madre a prepararlas, así aprendió gran parte de lo que hoy sabe y, desde hace 2 años inició su propio negocio vendiendo patacones, chuzos y comidas rápidas en general, cuenta con el apoyo de una de sus hijas y, con las ganancias que obtiene  lleva el sustento a su hogar y solventa los gastos básicos de la familia. Ella trabaja en el negocio de Viernes a Domingo y los demás días de la semana alterna esta actividad trabajando como empleada de oficios varios en diferentes casas, así complementa la entrada de dinero al hogar. Las ventas en el negocio en algunos momentos se han visto afectadas porque en el barrio donde reside se presentan algunos problemas de orden público y enfrentamientos entre bandas criminales del sector, sin embargo, Zulima no se desanima, por el contrario se caracteriza por ser una mujer dinámica, alegre y emprendedora, le gusta lo que hace ya que con su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijas, quienes son el motor principal de su vida. Esto la motiva a solicitar el ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas y surtido en general (salsas, carnes frías, panes, gaseosas), esto le permitirá ampliar su capacidad instalada con la que podrá dejar de preparar los alimentos en la cocina de su casa y, además podrá tener disponibilidad de insumos suficientes para satisfacer los diversos gustos de los comensales. Esto se reflejará en el aumento de las ventas y los ingresos, con los cuales pretende cumplir el sueño de adquirir un local propio en un futuro a mediano plazo, en el que pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y sus clientes puedan estar más cómodos, además desea generar empleo; de esta manera podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida y disfrutar de un mejor bienestar al lado de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Zulima, 44, is mother of two daughters and has been head of household since her husband died some time ago.  She’s sold fast-food for the last 20 years.  Initially her mother helped her make it and that’s how she learned most of what she knows today.  For the last two years she’s been in business for herself selling fried banana chips, meat kebabs and fast-food in general.  One of her daughters helps her and she uses profits earned to support her home and cover basic family expenses.  She works in her business Friday to Sunday and the other days of the week works as a domestic employee in various houses; this is how she adds to her household income. 

Sales in her business have been somewhat affected lately because her neighborhood has had some public order problems and clashes between rival criminal gangs in the area.  Nevertheless, Zulima does not become discouraged.  On the contrary, she’s known to be dynamic, cheerful and enterprising.  She likes what she does because she’s succeeded in raising her daughters, who are her main priority, thanks to her work.

This has motivated her to request a loan cycle to buy a fast-food cart and to stock up on supplies (sauces, cold cuts, bread, soft-drinks) which will make it possible for her to increase her capacity and to be able to stop producing the food in her home kitchen.  She will also have sufficient amounts of the necessary ingredients on hand to meet the various tastes of her diners.

This will be reflected in higher sales and income that she intends to use to reach her dream of acquiring a locale of her own in the future medium run so that she can offer greater variety of products and her customers can be more comfortable.  Also, she’d like to generate employment and be able to improve her living conditions and to enjoy better well-being in company of her daughters.

loans.use: to buy a fast-food cart and supplies for it.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: Además de dedicarse a las labores del hogar, María Luisa también se dedica a la producción de café, actividad que aprendió desde pequeña al lado de su padre. Ella es socia de la "Unión Regional" y allí entrega año con año la totalidad de su producción. Para este año solicita un crédito pues hace poco renovó parte de sus cafeteles y necesita comprar fertilizantes. Este crédito lo pagará al final de la cosecha y con las ganancias que obtenga se comprará un televisor nuevo para poder ver sus programas favoritos.
texts.en:
Aside from her household duties, María Luisa also produces coffee, an activity which she learned about from her father at a young age. She is a member of the "Regional Union" and she delivers all of her crops to them every year. 

She is applying for a loan for this year because she recently renovated a part of her coffee plantation and she needs to buy fertilizer. She will pay back this loan at the end of her harvest. With her earnings, she will buy a new television so that she can watch her favorite shows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate the floor of the house

loans.name: Abiabatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Abiabatu, from Tombo, a western rural area of Sierra Leone. She is married, with two children, ages 4 years and 10 years. Her older child is currently attending school. 

In 2009, Abiabatu established her home-products business. She began her business because she wanted a source of income to support her family. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometimes the flow of customers is very slow.

Abiabatu requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, Abiabatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale

loans.name: Shohruh

texts.ru: Шохрух молодой и энергичный человек. Он начал свой бизнес несколько лет назад и введет свой бизнес, до сегодняшнего дня успешно. Шохрух имеет свой мужской салон. Он преподносит услугу парикмахера. Он делает разнообразные стрижки. Шохруху помогает его отец Собирджон. Он еще не женат и скоро планирует жениться. Он должен провести торжество своего бракосочетания, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для проведения свадебного торжества. Этот займ поможет ему осуществить его мечту и стать счастливым. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shohruh is a young and energetic person. He started his business several years ago and has led it to the success it has today. Shohruh has a barber shop. He can create a variety of hairstyles. Shohruh is helped by his father, Sobirjon. He is not married, but is planning on getting married soon. He needs to celebrate the marriage, but has no money. He is asking for a loan of $3,000 to pay for the wedding celebration. This loan will help him achieve his dream and become happy. He is hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: pay for his wedding.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасану 21 года. Он живет вместе с родителями на северной части Таджикистана. Он еще не женат. Хасан умный и начитанный молодой человек. Хасан является студентом 3 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Бизнеса и индустрии. Он учится по специальности технология и информатика. Он учится отлично и в свободное время посещает библиотеку. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор и поэтому он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hassan is 21 years old. He lives with his parents in the northern part of Tajikistan. He is not married yet. Hasan is an intelligent and well-read young man. Hassan is a junior the Tajik State University of Business and Industry. He is majoring in technology and informatics. He is a good student who spends his spare time in the library. He has to pay tuition and is asking for a loan. He is hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: pay for tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay workers to harvest coffee

loans.name: Cerue

texts.en:
Cerue is 46 years old and comes from Liberia. She lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She did not attend school, but she said she is good at managing her home affairs and business. She is single and has five children, aged between 19 and 30. Only one of them is attending school and living at home.

For the past ten years, Cerue has been selling food ingredients in the local market, including pepper, oil, rice, bitter-ball, and okra. The problem she faces is sometimes sales go slowly, but most of the time she realizes profit. She uses her profits to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food ingredients to sell, like pepper, oil, rice, bitter-ball, and okra. She hopes to build a house and own a shop, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients to sell, like pepper, oil, and rice

loans.name: Rahshida

texts.ru: Рахшида родилась в 1994 году. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она студентка 2 курса Худжандского Государственного Университета. Она учится в факультете Педагогика и психология. Она учится отлично и в свободное время она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры как картофель и зерно. Она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Ее родители помогают ей. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 350 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Rahshida was born in 1994. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a sophomore at Khujand State University. She studies in the department of Pedagogy and Psychology. She is a good student, and in her spare time she is grows agricultural crops like potatoes and corn. She gets additional income from livestock. Her parents help her. She has to pay tuition, and has therefore applied for a loan. She is asking for a loan of $350 to pay tuition. She's anticipating for your kindness and hoping for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to make and sell clothing.

loans.name: Dúo Shalom Group

texts.es: Dúo Shalom, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Mayra de 34 años de edad, ella se a dedica a la venta de musica y peliculas en discos y videojuegos, y le ha ido bien en su negocio ya que en el area en que ella se encuentra vendiendo es muy transitada por personas y la mayoria le pasan comprando, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia en discos y videojuegos para la venta ya que su clientela le piden nuevos juegos y con el capital que tiene no le alcanza para invertir esperando que ustedes le sigan ayudando como hasta ahora. les agradese por la ayuda y por la confianza en su persona, y que Dios los bendiga.
texts.en: The group Dúo Shalom includes Señora Mayra, who is 34 years old. She sells music and video discs and video games, and her business has gone well for her, since the area where she sells has a lot of traffic, and the majority of people passing by buy something. At this time she is applying for this loan to buy merchandise such as discs and video games to sell, since her customers are asking her for new games, and the capital that she has is not enough to invest. She hopes that you will continue helping her as you have done up to now. She is grateful for the help and and for your confidence in her, and may God bless you.

loans.use: to buy music and video discs to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Sinkor, a part of Monrovia, the capital city of Liberia. Located in Montserrado County, it is well-known as the commercial city of Liberia. 

Josephine is 26 year old and unmarried, with three children between the ages of three and ten. Only two of her children are attending school and they all live at home. 

For the past six years now, Josephine has been running a table at the market, where she sells onions, rice, oil, and other items. She started this business with help from her father and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because it gives her more profit and makes her popular. 

Josephine is requesting a loan to buy more onions, rice, oil, and other items for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house.

loans.use: to buy more onions, rice, oil, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 38 years old and lives in Montserrado County, well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is single and has two children, ages 1 year and 14 years old; her older child attends school. Victoria completed the 12th grade before joining business. 

For the past five years she has been selling charcoal from a shop in the local market. Her major problem is the price of coal is very high. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal for her business. She plans to live a better life and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia, well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 45 years old and married with 6 children aged between 11 and 26 years old. Only five of her 6 children are in school and live at home. 

For the past ten years she has been selling rice, onion, flour, sugar, etc. in the local market. She started this business with help from her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She spends nine hours each day on her business. She likes her business because she makes more profit. 

Oretha is requesting a loan to buy more rice, onion, flour, sugar, etc. to expand her sales. She wants to get more money to build a house for her children and to educate them.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onion, flour, sugar, etc. to expand her sales

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 47 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 2 and 12 years. 

She runs a wood business in Tombo's western rural area in Freetown. She started her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income.  Adama has been in this business since 2008 and sells wood at her house.  She describes her major hardships as inadequate funds to run her business and a transportation problem.  

Adama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more wood to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future she would like to change her business to a food stand. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Otro Dia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OTRO DÍA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, venta de salchipapas, venta de computadoras, tejedora de ajuares de bebe, venta de deportivos, carpintería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo adquirio al fallecer su abuela, adquiriendo el  puesto y el negocio por herencia, lo que en la actualidad ayuda a su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The "Otro Día" ("Another Day") communal bank is beginning its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima regional hub. This group is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors, of which María is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include selling fruit, selling salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dogs), selling computers, sewing layettes, selling sneakers, and carpentry.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as María. She joined Pro Mujer six years ago by invitation from one of the institution's promoters, who visited her at home. She currently has a business selling fruit. She says that she took on this business when her grandmother died and she inherited the stall and the business. This business helps her family.

She will use this loan to increase her working capital by buying wholesale fruit from the traditional markets. She will later sell this fruit from her sales point. This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family, as she is in a common-law marriage with two children.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health workshops and the loans.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Zinnah

texts.en:
Zinnah lives in Sinkor, Montserrado County where living conditions are similar to the capital city of Liberia; it is well known as the well laidout place in Liberia. She is 47-years-old and married with five children between 11 and 22 years old.  Her children are in school and live at home. 

Since 2002 she has been selling coal by the bag in the community market.  Zinnah started this business with help from her husband, who works with LEC, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. She sells for as long as nine hours a day and gets picked up most of the time to get her goods to her shop. She likes her business because it makes her popular. 

She is requesting a loan to buy 15 more bags of coal to expand her sales.  She wants to get more money to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy 15 more bags of coal to expand her sales

loans.name: Ceeto

texts.en:
35-year-old Ceeto lives in Montserrado County, the capital city of Liberia which is well known as the commercial city  of Liberia. She completed 10th grade  and is single with two children aged 1 and 16 years old.  Her children live at home and only the oldest one is in school. 

Over the past four years she has been selling charcoal in the community market.  She started this business with help from her fiancé and learned this way of selling from her mother. She sells for 8 hours each day and uses a taxi most of the time to get her goods to her shop. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal to increase her sales. She wants to get more money to educate her children and build a house. She appreciates Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to increase her sales

loans.name: Amina

texts.ru: Амина родилась в 1960 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Она более 15 лет занимается изготовлением пирожков и самбуса. Она имеет большой опыт и справляется с бизнесом успешно. Она готовит вкусные пирожки и поэтому имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Благодаря упорному труду и терпению она начала зарабатывать деньги и вырастила своих детей. Она данное время строит новый дом для своей семьи, но она не имеет денег, чтобы завершить постройку дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1450 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, камень и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Amina was born in 1960. She is a widow and has two children. She has been making pirozhki and sambusa for over fifteen years. She makes delicious pirozhki has a successful business with regular customers. Thanks to her hard work and patience, she has begun to earn money and can support her children. Amina is currently building a new house for her family, but she does not have enough money to finish the construction. She has asked for a loan of $1450 in order to buy building materials such as cement, wood, stone, and so forth. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cement, wood, and stone to build a house

loans.name: Mujeres Creativas (Creative Women) Group

texts.en:
The seven women in Mujeres Creativas have a variety of businesses.  There is one small store and several businesses making and selling tortillas.  Also, one woman has a catalog business selling cosmetics.  These women are looking forward to the business education classes and the monthly visits from the Namaste Business Advisor who will help them write and implement their business plan.  They live and work in San Juan Alotenango, a small town not far from the city of Antigua.

Wendy Maribel, in the center of the photo, has had a small store for eight years.  She is married to a policeman who works in the city and only comes home for a few days every two weeks.  She has a daughter not yet in school, and she has one employee who helps her with childcare and with the store.  She plans to use her loan to buy personal care products that she does not currently carry, such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, and toothbrushes.  She is optimistic that when she learns how to handle her inventory and control her sales and expenses that she will be able to increase her profit and grow her business.

Currently, Wendy Maribel works 224 hours per month and has profits of approximately $139 US.  She anticipates that with her new products and her new knowledge, she will be able to increase her profits during the nine months of this program by more than 100%.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her tienda (small store)

loans.name: Ines Albertina
